member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting
member.summary: Describes the notification characteristics of a particular live region in an app UI. Used by <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLiveSetting?text=GetLiveSetting> and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationProperties.LiveSetting?text=AutomationProperties.LiveSetting>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Assertive
member.summary: The element sends interruptive notifications if the content of the live region has changed. With this setting, Microsoft UI Automation clients and assistive technology are expected to interrupt the user to inform of changes to the live region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Off
member.summary: The element does not send notifications if the content of the live region has changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationLiveSetting.Polite
member.summary: The element sends non-interruptive notifications if the content of the live region has changed. With this setting, Microsoft UI Automation clients and assistive technology are expected to not interrupt the user to inform of changes to the live region.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNavigationDirection
member.summary: Defines the directions of navigation within the Microsoft UI Automation tree.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNavigationDirection.FirstChild
member.summary: Navigate to the first child of the current node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNavigationDirection.LastChild
member.summary: Navigate to the last child of the current node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNavigationDirection.NextSibling
member.summary: Navigate to the next sibling of the current node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNavigationDirection.Parent
member.summary: Navigate to the parent of the current node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNavigationDirection.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Navigate to the previous sibling of the current node.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind
member.summary: Indicates the type of notification when calling <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.RaiseNotificationEvent(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing,System.String,System.String)?text=RaiseNotificationEvent>

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ActionAborted
member.summary: The current element has a notification that an action was abandoned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ActionCompleted
member.summary: The current element has a notification that an action was completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ItemAdded
member.summary: The current element container has had something added to it that should be presented to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.ItemRemoved
member.summary: The current element has had something removed from inside it that should be presented to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationKind.Other
member.summary: The current element has a notification not an add, remove, completed, or aborted action.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing
member.summary: Specifies the order in which to process a notification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.All
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. All of the notifications from this source should be delivered to the user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.CurrentThenMostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. Don’t interrupt the current notification for this one. If new notifications come in from the same source while the current notification is being presented, then keep the most recent and ignore the rest until the current processing is completed. Then use the most recent message as the current message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.ImportantAll
member.summary:
These notifications should be presented to the user as soon as possible. All of the notifications from this source should be delivered to the user.
> [!WARNING] > Use this in a limited capacity as this style of message could cause a flooding for information to the end user due to the nature of the request to deliver all of the notifications.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.ImportantMostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user as soon as possible. The most recent notifications from this source should be delivered to the user because the most recent notification supersedes all of the other notifications.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationNotificationProcessing.MostRecent
member.summary: These notifications should be presented to the user when possible. Interrupt the current notification for this one.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the orientation direction in which a control can be presented. Values are used by <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation?text=GetOrientation>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation.Horizontal

member.summary: Gets the name of this annotation type.
member.returns: The name of this annotation type.

member.summary: Gets the name of the annotation author.
member.returns: The name of the annotation author.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IAnnotationProvider.DateTime
member.summary: Gets the date and time when this annotation was created.
member.returns: The date and time when this annotation was created.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IAnnotationProvider.Target
member.summary: Gets the UI Automation element that is being annotated.

member.summary: Gets the next element in the specified direction within the logical UI tree.
member.param: The specified direction.
member.returns: The next element.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDockProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by a Microsoft UI Automation client to controls that expose their dock properties in a docking container. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPattern(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface)?text=AutomationPeer.GetPattern> call and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?text=PatternInterface.Dock>.

member.summary: Docks the control in a docking container.
member.param: The dock position, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and to other elements in the container.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDockProvider.DockPosition
member.summary: Gets the current <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.DockPosition?text=DockPosition> of the control in a docking container.
member.returns: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.DockPosition?text=DockPosition> of the control, relative to the boundaries of the docking container and to other elements in the container.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDragProvider
member.summary: Enables a Microsoft UI Automation element to describe itself as an element that can be dragged as part of a drag-and-drop operation. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPattern(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface)?text=AutomationPeer.GetPattern> call and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?text=PatternInterface.Drag>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDragProvider.GetGrabbedItems
member.summary: Gets an array of UI Automation elements that are being dragged as part of this drag operation.
member.returns: An array of UI Automation elements that are being dragged. Null if this item is an individual item being dragged. Used to enable providers that support dragging multiple items at a time to create an intermediary <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDragProvider?text=IDragProvider> that encapsulates all of the items being dragged.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDragProvider.DropEffect
member.summary: Gets a string that indicates what will happen when the item is dropped.
member.returns: A string that indicates what will happen when the item is dropped.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDragProvider.DropEffects
member.summary: Gets an array of strings that enumerates possible drop effects when this item is dropped.
member.returns: An array of strings that enumerates possible drop effects when this item is dropped.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDragProvider.IsGrabbed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an item is currently being dragged.
member.returns: true if the item is being dragged. Otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDropTargetProvider
member.summary: Enables a Microsoft UI Automation element to describe itself as an element that can receive a drop of a dragged element as part of a drag-and-drop operation. member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDropTargetProvider.DropEffect
member.summary: Gets a string that indicates what will happen when the item is dropped.
member.returns: A string that indicates what will happen when the item is dropped.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IDropTargetProvider.DropEffects
member.summary: Gets an array of strings that enumerates possible drop effects when this item is dropped.
member.returns: An array of strings that enumerates possible drop effects when this item is dropped.

member.summary: Hides all nodes, controls, or content that are descendants of the control.

member.summary: Displays all child nodes, controls, or content of the control.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IInvokeProvider
member.summary: Exposes a method to support Microsoft UI Automation access to controls that initiate or perform a single, unambiguous action and do not maintain state when activated. member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IInvokeProvider.Invoke
member.summary: Sends a request to initiate or perform the single, unambiguous action of the provider control. For example, the invoke action for a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Button?text=Button> is click.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IItemContainerProvider
member.summary: Exposes a Microsoft UI Automation method to enable applications to find an element in a container, such as a virtualized list. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPattern(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface)?text=AutomationPeer.GetPattern> call and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?text=PatternInterface.ItemContainer>.

member.summary: Retrieves an element by the specified property value.
member.param: The item in the container after which to begin the search.
The property that contains the value to retrieve.
The value to retrieve.
member.returns: The first item that matches the search criterion; otherwise, null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IMultipleViewProvider

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IRangeValueProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by a Microsoft UI Automation client to controls that can be set to a value within a range. member.summary: Gets the value that is added to or subtracted from the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IRangeValueProvider.Value?text=Value> property when a large change is made, such as with the PAGE DOWN key.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IRawElementProviderSimple
member.summary: Provides methods and properties that expose basic information about a UI element. IRawElementProviderSimple is a Windows Runtime class, not an interface.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollItemProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by Microsoft UI Automation client to individual child controls of containers that implement <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider?text=IScrollProvider>. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPattern(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface)?text=AutomationPeer.GetPattern> call and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?text=PatternInterface.ScrollItem>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollItemProvider.ScrollIntoView
member.summary: Scrolls the content area of a container object in order to display the control within the visible region (viewport) of the container.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by a Microsoft UI Automation client to a control that acts as a scrollable container for a collection of child objects. The children of this element must implement <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollItemProvider?text=IScrollItemProvider>. Implement IScrollProvider in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPattern(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface)?text=AutomationPeer.GetPattern> call and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?text=PatternInterface.Scroll>.

member.summary: Scrolls the visible region of the content area horizontally, vertically, or both.
member.param: The horizontal increment that is specific to the control. Pass <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollPatternIdentifiers.NoScroll?text=NoScroll> if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.
The vertical increment that is specific to the control. Pass <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollPatternIdentifiers.NoScroll?text=NoScroll> if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.SetScrollPercent(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the horizontal and vertical scroll position as a percentage of the total content area within the control.
member.param: The horizontal position as a percentage of the content area's total range. Pass <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollPatternIdentifiers.NoScroll?text=NoScroll> if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.

The vertical position as a percentage of the content area's total range. Pass <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollPatternIdentifiers.NoScroll?text=NoScroll> if the control cannot be scrolled in this direction.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontallyScrollable
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control can scroll horizontally.
member.returns: true if the control can scroll horizontally; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontalScrollPercent

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.HorizontalViewSize

member.returns: The horizontal size of the viewable region as a percentage of the total content area within the control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.VerticallyScrollable
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control can scroll vertically.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider.VerticalScrollPercent

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by a Microsoft UI Automation client to individual, selectable child controls of containers that implement <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider?text=ISelectionProvider>. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPattern(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface)?text=AutomationPeer.GetPattern> call and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?text=PatternInterface.SelectionItem>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.AddToSelection
member.summary: Adds the current element to the collection of selected items.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.RemoveFromSelection
member.summary: Removes the current element from the collection of selected items.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.Select
member.summary: Clears any existing selection and then selects the current element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.IsSelected
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether an item is selected.
member.returns: true if the element is selected; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider.SelectionContainer
member.summary: Gets the UI Automation provider that implements <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider?text=ISelectionProvider> and acts as the container for the calling object.
member.returns: The UI Automation provider.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by a Microsoft UI Automation client to controls that act as containers for a collection of individual, selectable child items. The children of this element must implement <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionItemProvider?text=ISelectionItemProvider>. Implement ISelectionProvider in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPattern(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface)?text=AutomationPeer.GetPattern> call and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?text=PatternInterface.SelectionItem>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider.GetSelection
member.summary: Retrieves a UI Automation provider for each child element that is selected.
member.returns: An array of UI Automation providers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider.CanSelectMultiple
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the Microsoft UI Automation provider allows more than one child element to be selected concurrently.
member.returns: true if multiple selection is allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ISelectionProvider.IsSelectionRequired
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the UI Automation provider requires at least one child element to be selected.
member.returns: true if selection is required; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITableProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by a Microsoft UI Automation client to controls that act as containers for a collection of child elements. The children of this element must implement <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITableItemProvider?text=ITableItemProvider> and be organized in a two-dimensional logical coordinate system that can be traversed (a Microsoft UI Automation client can move to adjacent controls, which are headers or cells of the table) by using the keyboard.

member.summary: Adds to the collection of highlighted text in a text container that supports multiple disjoint selections.

member.summary: Returns a new <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider?text=ITextRangeProvider> that is identical to the original <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider?text=ITextRangeProvider> and that inherits all the properties of the original.

member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether two text ranges have identical endpoints.
member.param: The Start or End endpoint of the caller.
The target range for comparison.
The Start or End endpoint of the target.
member.returns: Returns a negative value if the caller's endpoint occurs earlier in the text than the target endpoint. Returns zero if the caller's endpoint is at the same location as the target endpoint. Returns a positive value if the caller's endpoint occurs later in the text than the target endpoint.

The attribute value to search for. This value must match the type specified for the attribute.
true if the last occurring text range should be returned instead of the first; otherwise, false.
member.returns: A text range that has a matching attribute ID and attribute value; otherwise null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.FindText(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a text range subset that contains the specified text.
member.param: The text string to search for.
true to return the last occurring text range instead of the first; otherwise, false.
true to ignore case; otherwise, false.
member.returns: A text range that matches the specified text; otherwise null.

member.summary: Retrieves the value of the specified attribute ID across the text range.
member.param: The text attribute ID.
member.returns: Retrieves an object that represents the value of the specified attribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.GetBoundingRectangles(System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of bounding rectangles for each fully or partially visible line of text in a text range.
member.param: An array of bounding rectangles for each full or partial line of text in a text range. An empty array for a degenerate range. An empty array for a text range that has screen coordinates placing it completely off-screen, scrolled out of view, or obscured by an overlapping window. <!--These are doubles not rects, so something is amiss or could be clarified, but this exactly how it is for .NET.-->

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.GetChildren
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of all the embedded objects that exist within the text range.
member.returns: A collection of child objects that exist within the range. Child objects that overlap with the text range but are not completely enclosed by it are also included in the collection. Returns an empty collection if no child objects exist.

member.summary: Returns the innermost element that encloses the text range.
member.returns: The enclosing control, typically the text provider that provides the text range. However, if the text provider supports child text elements such as tables or hyperlinks, the enclosing element can be a descendant of the text provider.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.GetText(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the plain text of the range.
member.param: The maximum length of the string to return. Use – 1 to specify an unlimited length.
member.returns: The plain text of the text range, which might represent a portion of the full string truncated at the specified maxLength.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.Move(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Text.TextUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the text range the specified number of text units.
member.param: The text unit boundary.
The number of text units to move. A positive value moves the text range forward; a negative value moves the text range backward; and a value of 0 has no effect.
member.returns: The number of units actually moved. This value can be less than the count requested if either of the new text range endpoints is greater than or less than the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextProvider.DocumentRange?text=DocumentRange> endpoints. This value can be negative if navigation is happening in the backward direction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.MoveEndpointByRange(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Text.TextPatternRangeEndpoint,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Text.TextPatternRangeEndpoint)
member.summary: Moves one endpoint of a text range to the specified endpoint of a second text range.
member.param: The endpoint to move.
Another range from the same text provider.
An endpoint on the other range.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.MoveEndpointByUnit(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Text.TextPatternRangeEndpoint,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Text.TextUnit,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves one endpoint of the text range the specified number of text units within the document range.
member.param: The endpoint to move.
The text measure unit for moving.
The number of units to move. A positive value moves the endpoint forward. A negative value moves it backward. A value of 0 has no effect.
member.returns: The number of units actually moved, which can be less than the number requested if moving the endpoint runs into the beginning or end of the document.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.RemoveFromSelection
member.summary: From the collection of highlighted text in a text container that supports multiple disjoint selections, removes a highlighted section of text that corresponds to the caller's text range endpoints.

member.summary: Causes the text control to scroll vertically until the text range is visible in the viewport.
member.param: true if the text control should be scrolled so that the text range is flush with the top of the viewport; false if the text range is flush with the bottom of the viewport.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider.Select
member.summary: Highlights text in the text control that corresponds to the start and end endpoints of the text range.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider2
member.summary: Extends the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider?text=ITextRange> interface to enable Microsoft UI Automation providers to programmatically open context menus that are contextual to text input operations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider2.ShowContextMenu
member.summary: Shows the available context menu for the owner element.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IToggleProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support Microsoft UI Automation client access to controls that can cycle through a set of states and maintain a particular state. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPattern(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface)?text=AutomationPeer.GetPattern> call and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?text=PatternInterface.Toggle>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IToggleProvider.Toggle
member.summary: Cycles through the toggle states of a control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IToggleProvider.ToggleState
member.summary: Gets the toggle state of the control.
member.returns: The toggle state of the control, as a value of the enumeration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider
member.summary: Exposes methods and properties to support access by a Microsoft UI Automation client to controls or elements that can be moved, resized, or rotated within a two-dimensional space. Implement this interface in order to support the capabilities that an automation client requests with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetPattern(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface)?text=AutomationPeer.GetPattern> call and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface?text=PatternInterface.Transform>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.Move(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Moves the control.
member.param: The absolute screen coordinates of the left side of the control.
The absolute screen coordinates of the top of the control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.Resize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Resizes the control.
member.param: The new width of the window, in pixels.
The new height of the window, in pixels.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.Rotate(System.Double)
member.summary: Rotates the control.
member.param: The number of degrees to rotate the control. A positive number rotates the control clockwise. A negative number rotates the control counterclockwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.CanMove
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the element can be moved.
member.returns: true if the element can be moved; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.CanResize
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the element can be resized.
member.returns: true if the element can be resized; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider.CanRotate
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the element can be rotated.
member.returns: true if the element can be rotated; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Extends the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITransformProvider?text=ITransformProvider> interface to enable Microsoft UI Automation providers to expose API to support the viewport zooming functionality of a control.

member.summary: Zooms the viewport of the control.

member.summary: Gets the zoom level of the control's viewport.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IValueProvider

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount
member.summary: Contains values that are used by the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.IScrollProvider?text=IScrollProvider> pattern to indicate the direction and distance to scroll.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.LargeDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in large decrements, which is equivalent to pressing the PAGE UP key or to clicking a blank part of a scrollbar. If the distance represented by the PAGE UP key is not a relevant amount for the control, or if no scrollbar exists, the value represents an amount equal to the size of the currently visible window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.LargeIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in large increments, which is equivalent to pressing the PAGE DOWN key or to clicking a blank part of a scrollbar. If the distance represented by the PAGE DOWN key is not a relevant amount for the control, or if no scrollbar exists, the value represents an amount equal to the size of the currently visible region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.NoAmount
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling should not be performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.SmallDecrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in small decrements, which is equivalent to pressing an arrow key or to clicking the arrow button on a scrollbar.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.ScrollAmount.SmallIncrement
member.summary: Specifies that scrolling is performed in small increments, which is equivalent to pressing an arrow key or to clicking the arrow button on a scrollbar.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum
member.summary: Defines constants that identify text attributes of a Microsoft UI Automation text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.AnimationStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the AnimationStyle text attribute, which specifies the type of animation applied to the text. This attribute is specified as a value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationAnimationStyle?text=AutomationAnimationStyle> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.AnnotationObjectsAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the AnnotationObjects text attribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.AnnotationTypesAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the AnnotationTypes text attribute, which maintains a list of annotation type identifiers for a range of text. This attribute is specified as a value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AnnotationType?text=AnnotationType> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.BackgroundColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the BackgroundColor text attribute, which specifies the background color of the text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.BulletStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the BulletStyle text attribute, which specifies the style of bullets used in the text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationBulletStyle?text=AutomationBulletStyle> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CapStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the CapStyle text attribute, which specifies the capitalization style for the text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CaretBidiModeAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the CaretBidiMode text attribute, which indicates the direction of text flow in the text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationCaretBidiMode?text=AutomationCaretBidiMode> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CaretPositionAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the CaretPosition text attribute, which indicates whether the caret is at the beginning or the end of a line of text in the text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationCaretPosition?text=AutomationCaretPosition> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.CultureAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the Culture text attribute, which specifies the locale of the text by locale identifier (LCID).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.FontNameAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the FontName text attribute, which specifies the name of the font. Examples: "Arial Black"; "Arial Narrow". The font name string is not localized.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.FontSizeAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the FontSize text attribute, which specifies the point size of the font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.FontWeightAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the FontWeight text attribute, which specifies the relative stroke, thickness, or boldness of the font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.ForegroundColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the ForegroundColor text attribute, which specifies the foreground color of the text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.HorizontalTextAlignmentAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the HorizontalTextAlignment text attribute, which specifies how the text is aligned horizontally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IndentationFirstLineAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IndentationFirstLine text attribute, which specifies how far, in points, to indent the first line of a paragraph.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IndentationLeadingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IndentationLeading text attribute, which specifies the leading indentation, in points.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IndentationTrailingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IndentationTrailing text attribute, which specifies the trailing indentation, in points.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsActiveAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsActive text attribute, which indicates whether the control that contains the text range has the keyboard focus (true) or not (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsHiddenAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsHidden text attribute, which indicates whether the text is hidden (true) or visible (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsItalicAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsItalic text attribute, which indicates whether the text is italic (true) or not (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsReadOnlyAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsReadOnly text attribute, which indicates whether the text is read-only (true) or can be modified (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsSubscriptAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsSubscript text attribute, which indicates whether the text is subscript (true) or not (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.IsSuperscriptAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the IsSuperscript text attribute, which indicates whether the text is subscript (true) or not (false).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.LinkAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the Link text attribute, which contains the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.Provider.ITextRangeProvider?text=ITextRangeProvider> interface of the text range that is the target of an internal link in a document.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginBottomAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the MarginBottom text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the bottom margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginLeadingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the MarginLeading text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the leading margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginTopAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the MarginTop text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the top margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.MarginTrailingAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the MarginTrailing text attribute, which specifies the size, in points, of the trailing margin applied to the page associated with the text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.OutlineStylesAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the OutlineStyles text attribute, which specifies the outline style of the text. This attribute is specified as a value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationOutlineStyles?text=AutomationOutlineStyles> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.OverlineColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the OverlineColor text attribute, which specifies the color of the overline text decoration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.OverlineStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the OverlineStyle text attribute, which specifies the style of the overline text decoration. This attribute is specified as a value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle?text=AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.SelectionActiveEndAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the SelectionActiveEnd text attribute, which indicates the location of the caret relative to a text range that represents the currently selected text. This attribute is specified as a value from the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationActiveEnd?text=AutomationActiveEnd> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StrikethroughColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the StrikethroughColor text attribute, which specifies the color of the strikethrough text decoration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StrikethroughStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the StrikethroughStyle text attribute, which specifies the style of the strikethrough text decoration. This attribute is specified as a value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle?text=AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StyleIdAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the StyleId text attribute, which indicates the text styles in use for a text range. This attribute is specified as a value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationStyleId?text=AutomationStyleId> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.StyleNameAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the StyleName text attribute, which identifies the localized name of the text style in use for a text range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.TabsAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the Tabs text attribute, which is an array specifying the tab stops for the text range. Each array element specifies a distance, in points, from the leading margin.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.TextFlowDirectionsAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the TextFlowDirections text attribute, which specifies the direction of text flow. This attribute is specified as a combination of values of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationFlowDirections?text=AutomationFlowDirections> enumeration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.UnderlineColorAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the UnderlineColor text attribute, which specifies the color of the underline text decoration.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.AutomationTextAttributesEnum.UnderlineStyleAttribute
member.summary: Identifies the UnderlineStyle text attribute, which specifies the style of the underline text decoration. This attribute is specified as a value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Automation.AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle?text=AutomationTextDecorationLineStyle> enumeration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BindingFailedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides event data for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.BindingFailed?text=DebugSettings.BindingFailed> event.

member.summary: Gets the explanation of the binding failure.

The event data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions
member.summary: Represents the options that can be applied when an element is brought into view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions?text=BringIntoViewOptions> class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.AnimationDesired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to use animation when the element is brought into view.
member.returns: true to use animation; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.HorizontalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Controls the positioning of the vertical axis of the TargetRect with respect to the vertical axis of the viewport. The value is clamped from 0.0f to 1.0f with 0.0f representing the left vertical edge and 1.0f representing the right vertical edge. By default this is set to 0.0f.
member.returns: A value that specifies the positioning of the vertical axis of the TargetRect with respect to the vertical axis of the viewport. The default is 0.0f.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.HorizontalAlignmentRatio?text=HorizontalAlignmentRatio>.
member.returns: The horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.HorizontalAlignmentRatio?text=HorizontalAlignmentRatio>.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.TargetRect
member.summary: Gets or sets the area of an element to bring into view.
member.returns: A rectangle that defines the area of an element to bring into view.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.VerticalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Controls the positioning of the horizontal axis of the TargetRect with respect to the horizontal axis of the viewport. The value is clamped from 0.0f to 1.0f with 0.0f representing the top horizontal edge and 1.0f representing the bottom horizontal edge. By default this is set to 0.0f.
member.returns: A value that specifies the positioning of the horizontal axis of the TargetRect with respect to the horizontal axis of the viewport. The default is 0.0f.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.VerticalAlignmentRatio?text=VerticalAlignmentRatio>.
member.returns: The vertical distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewOptions.VerticalAlignmentRatio?text=VerticalAlignmentRatio>.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.BringIntoViewRequested?text=UIElement.BringIntoViewRequested> event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.AnimationDesired
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the scrolling should be animated.
member.returns: true to animate the scrolling; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled. A true value prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: true to mark the routed event handled. false to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.HorizontalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Gets the requested horizontal alignment ratio which controls the alignment of the vertical axis of the TargetRect with respect to the vertical axis of the viewport.
member.returns: The requested horizontal alignment ratio between 0.0 and 1.0, or NaN. See Remarks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.HorizontalAlignmentRatio?text=HorizontalAlignmentRatio>.
member.returns: The horizontal distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.HorizontalAlignmentRatio?text=HorizontalAlignmentRatio>.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.TargetElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the element that should be made visible in response to the event.
member.returns: The element that should be made visible in response to the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.TargetRect
member.summary: Gets or sets the Rect in the TargetElement’s coordinate space to bring into view.
member.returns: The Rect in the TargetElement’s coordinate space to bring into view.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.VerticalAlignmentRatio
member.summary: Gets the requested vertical alignment ratio which controls the alignment of the horizontal axis of the TargetRect with respect to the horizontal axis of the viewport.
member.returns: The requested vertical alignment ratio between 0.0 and 1.0, or NaN. See Remarks.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.VerticalOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.VerticalAlignmentRatio?text=VerticalAlignmentRatio>.
member.returns: The vertical distance to add to the viewport-relative position of the TargetRect after satisfying the requested <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.BringIntoViewRequestedEventArgs.VerticalAlignmentRatio?text=VerticalAlignmentRatio>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.AnimatedVisualPlayer.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the currently playing animated visual, or does nothing if no play is underway.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.AnimatedVisualPlayer.PlayAsync(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts playing the loaded animated visual, or does nothing if no animated visual is loaded.
member.param: The point from which to start the animation, as a value from 0 to 1.
The point at which to finish the animation, as a value from 0 to 1.
If true, the animation loops continuously between _fromProgress_ and _toProgress_. If false, the animation plays once then stops.
member.returns: An async action that is completed when the play is stopped or, if _looped_ is not set, when the play reaches _toProgress_.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.AnimatedVisualPlayer.Resume
member.summary: Resumes the currently paused animated visual, or does nothing if there is no animated visual loaded or the animated visual is not paused.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.AnimatedVisualPlayer.SetProgress(System.Double)
member.summary: Moves the progress of the animated visual to the given value, or does nothing if no animated visual is loaded.
member.param: A value from 0 to 1 that represents the progress of the animated visual.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.AnimatedVisualPlayer.Stop
member.summary: Stops the current play, or does nothing if no play is underway.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how animations are cached when the AnimatedVisualPlayer is idle (when PlayAsync is not active).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.CalendarView.IsGroupLabelVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the month name is shown with the first day of the month when the DisplayMode is Month, or whether the year name is shown with the first month of the year when the DisplayMode is Year.
member.returns:
true if the month name is shown with the first day of the month; otherwise, false. The default is false.
The formatting of the group label can be set with the FirstOfMonthLabel properties (for example <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.CalendarView.FirstOfMonthLabelFontSize?text=FirstOfMonthLabelFontSize>) and FirstOfMonthYearDecadeLabel properties (for example <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.CalendarView.FirstOfYearDecadeLabelFontSize?text=FirstOfYearDecadeLabelFontSize>).

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.CandidateWindowAlignment
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how the Input Method Editor (IME) window for text predictions is aligned with a text edit control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.CandidateWindowAlignment.BottomEdge
member.summary: When the hardware keyboard is used, the Input Method Editor (IME) aligns to the bottom edge and left side of the text edit control. When the Soft Input Panel (SIP) is used, the Input Method Editor (IME) is docked to the Soft Input Panel (SIP).

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.CandidateWindowAlignment.Default
member.summary: When the hardware keyboard is used, the Input Method Editor (IME) follows the cursor. When the Soft Input Panel (SIP) is used, the Input Method Editor (IME) is docked to the Soft Input Panel (SIP).

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ClickMode

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ClickMode.Hover
member.summary: Specifies that the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Click?text=Click> event should be raised when the mouse pointer moves over the control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ClickMode.Press
member.summary: Specifies that the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Click?text=Click> event should be raised when the mouse button is pressed and the mouse pointer is over the control. If you are using the keyboard, specifies that the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Click?text=Click> event should be raised when the SPACEBAR or ENTER key is pressed and the control has keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ClickMode.Release
member.summary: Specifies that the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Click?text=Click> event should be raised when the left mouse button is pressed and released, and the mouse pointer is over the control. If you are using the keyboard, specifies that the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Click?text=Click> event should be raised when the SPACEBAR or ENTER key is pressed and released, and the control has keyboard focus.

member.summary: Occurs when a new navigation is requested.

member.summary: Occurs when an error is raised while navigating to the requested content.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame?text=Frame> class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.GoBack
member.summary: Navigates to the most recent item in back navigation history, if a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame?text=Frame> manages its own navigation history.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.GoBack(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.NavigationTransitionInfo)
member.summary: Navigates to the most recent item in back navigation history, if a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame?text=Frame> manages its own navigation history, and specifies the animated transition to use.
member.param: Info about the animated transition to use.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.GoForward
member.summary: Navigates to the most recent item in forward navigation history, if a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame?text=Frame> manages its own navigation history.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.Navigate(Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,System.Object,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.NavigationTransitionInfo)
member.summary: Causes the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame?text=Frame> to load content represented by the specified <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Page?text=Page>-derived data type, also passing a parameter to be interpreted by the target of the navigation, and a value indicating the animated transition to use.
member.param: The page to navigate to, specified as a type reference to its partial class type. (A type reference is given as System.Type.

The navigation parameter to pass to the target page; must have a basic type (string, char, numeric, or GUID to support parameter serialization using <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.GetNavigationState?text=GetNavigationState>.
Info about the animated transition.
member.returns: false if a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.NavigationFailed?text=NavigationFailed> event handler has set <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationFailedEventArgs.Handled?text=Handled> to true; otherwise, true. See Remarks for more info.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame.Navigate(Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,System.Object)
member.summary: Causes the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame?text=Frame> to load content represented by the specified <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Page?text=Page>, also passing a parameter to be interpreted by the target of the navigation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.IKeyIndexMapping.IndexFromKey(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the index of the item that has the specified unique identifier (key).
member.param: The unique identifier (key) of the item to find the index of.
member.returns: The index of the item with the specified _key_.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.IKeyIndexMapping.KeyFromIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the unique identifier (key) for the item at the specified index.
member.param: The index of the item to get the key for.
member.returns: The unique identifier (key) for the item at the specified _index_.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image
member.summary: Represents a control that displays an image. The image source is specified by referring to an image file, using several supported formats. The image source can also be set with a stream. See Remarks for the list of supported image source formats.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.ImageFailed
member.summary: Occurs when there is an error associated with image retrieval or format.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.ImageOpened
member.summary: Occurs when the image source is downloaded and decoded with no failure. You can use this event to determine the natural size of the image source.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image?text=Image> class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.GetAlphaMask
member.summary: Returns a mask that represents the alpha channel of an image as a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionBrush?text=CompositionBrush>.
member.returns: A mask that represents the alpha channel of an image.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.GetAsCastingSource
member.summary: Returns the image as a CastingSource.
member.returns: The image as a CastingSource.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.NineGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value for a nine-grid metaphor that controls how the image can be resized. The nine-grid metaphor enables you to stretch edges and corners of an image differently than its center. See Remarks for more info and an illustration.
member.returns: A <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Thickness?text=Thickness> value that sets the Left, Top, Right, Bottom measurements for the nine-grid resizing metaphor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.NineGridProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.NineGrid?text=NineGrid> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.NineGrid?text=NineGrid> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the source for the image.
member.returns: An object that represents the image source file for the drawn image. Typically you set this with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage?text=BitmapImage> object, constructed with the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that describes the path to a valid image source file. Or, you can initialize a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource?text=BitmapSource> with a stream, perhaps a stream from a storage file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.SourceProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.Source?text=Source> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.Source?text=Source> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that describes how an <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image?text=Image> should be stretched to fill the destination rectangle.
member.returns: A value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Stretch?text=Stretch> enumeration that specifies how the source image is rendered, if the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Height?text=Height> and/or <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Width?text=Width> of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image?text=Image> are not explicitly specified. The default value is Uniform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.StretchProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.Stretch?text=Stretch> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Image.Stretch?text=Stretch> dependency property.

member.summary: Uses an "edge" offset for incremental loading visual behavior, and enables the list view to notify the scroll host of incremental load per interaction with other settings (<xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ListViewBase.IncrementalLoadingThreshold?text=IncrementalLoadingThreshold>, <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ListViewBase.DataFetchSize?text=DataFetchSize>).

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.IndexBasedLayoutOrientation
member.summary: Defines constants that specify whether there is a correlation between the items indices and how they are laid out.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.IndexBasedLayoutOrientation.LeftToRight
member.summary: The items are laid out horizontally by increasing index number.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.IndexBasedLayoutOrientation.None
member.summary: There is no correlation between the layout of the items and their index numbers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.IndexBasedLayoutOrientation.TopToBottom
member.summary: The items are laid out vertically by increasing index number.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.InfoBar
member.summary: An InfoBar is an inline notification for essential app-wide messages. The InfoBar will take up space in a layout and will not cover up other content or float on top of it. It supports rich content (including titles, messages, icons, and buttons) and can be configured to be user-dismissable or persistent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.InfoBarSeverity.Error
member.summary: Communicates that the InfoBar is displaying information regarding an error or problem that has occurred. For assistive technologies, they will follow the behavior set in the NotificationProcessing_ImportantAll constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.InfoBarSeverity.Informational
member.summary: Communicates that the InfoBar is displaying general information that requires the user's attention. For assistive technologies, they will follow the behavior set in the Processing_All constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.InfoBarSeverity.Success
member.summary: Communicates that the InfoBar is displaying information regarding a long-running and/or background task that has completed successfully. For assistive technologies, they will follow the behavior set in the Processing_All constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.InfoBarSeverity.Warning
member.summary: Communicates that the InfoBar is displaying information regarding a condition that might cause a problem in the future. For assistive technologies, they will follow the behavior set in the NotificationProcessing_ImportantAll constant.

member.summary: Determines the horizontal position of the ScrollViewer's _anchor point_ with respect to the viewport. By default, the ScrollViewer selects an element as its <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ItemsRepeaterScrollHost.CurrentAnchor?text=CurrentAnchor> by identifying the element in its viewport nearest to the anchor point.
member.returns: A normalized value (0.0 to 1.0). The default is 0.0.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout
member.summary: Represents the base class for an object that sizes and arranges child elements for a host.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.ArrangeInvalidated
member.summary: Occurs when the arrange state (layout) has been invalidated.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.MeasureInvalidated
member.summary: Occurs when the measurement state (layout) has been invalidated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.Arrange(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Positions child elements and determines a size for a container UIElement. Container elements that support attached layouts should call this method from their layout override implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The final size that the container computes for the child in layout.
member.returns: The actual size that is used after the element is arranged in layout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.InitializeForContext(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LayoutContext)
member.summary: Initializes any per-container state the layout requires when it is attached to a UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.InvalidateArrange
member.summary: Invalidates the arrange state (layout) for all UIElement containers that reference this layout. After the invalidation, the UIElement will have its layout updated, which occurs asynchronously.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.InvalidateMeasure
member.summary: Invalidates the measurement state (layout) for all UIElement containers that reference this layout.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.Measure(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Suggests a DesiredSize for a container element. A container element that supports attached layouts should call this method from their own MeasureOverride implementations to form a recursive layout update. The attached layout is expected to call the Measure for each of the container’s UIElement children.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

The available space that a container can allocate to a child object. A child object can request a larger space than what is available; the provided size might be accommodated if scrolling or other resize behavior is possible in that particular container.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.SetIndexBasedLayoutOrientation(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.IndexBasedLayoutOrientation)
member.summary: Sets the value of the IndexBasedLayoutOrientation property.
member.param: A value of the enumeration that indicates the orientation, if any, in which items are laid out based on their index in the source collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.UninitializeForContext(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LayoutContext)
member.summary: Removes any state the layout previously stored on the UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Layout.IndexBasedLayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets the orientation, if any, in which items are laid out based on their index in the source collection.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration that indicates the orientation, if any, in which items are laid out based on their index in the source collection. The default is None (see Remarks).

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are aligned on the horizontal axis in a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayout?text=LinedFlowLayout>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.Center
member.summary: Items are aligned in the center of the line, with extra space at the start and end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.End
member.summary: Items are aligned with the end of the line, with extra space at the start. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceAround
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly before and after each item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceBetween
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly between adjacent items. No space is added at the start or end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceEvenly
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly before and after each item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsJustification.Start
member.summary: Items are aligned with the start of the line, with extra space at the end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsStretch
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are sized to fill the available space in a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayout?text=LinedFlowLayout>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsStretch.Fill
member.summary: The item is sized to fill the available space in the non-scrolling direction. Item size in the scrolling direction is not changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayoutItemsStretch.None
member.summary: The item retains its natural size. Use of extra space is determined by the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.LinedFlowLayout.ItemsJustification?text=ItemsJustification> property.

member.summary: The pane is shown on the left side of the control. Only the pane icons are shown by default.

member.summary: The pane is shown on the left side of the control. Only the pane menu button is shown by default.

member.summary: The pane is shown at the top of the control.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, initializes any per-container state the layout requires when it is attached to a UIElement container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.MeasureOverride(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext,Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own "Measure" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.
The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayout.UninitializeForContextCore(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NonVirtualizingLayoutContext)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, removes any state the layout previously stored on the UIElement container.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NumberBoxSpinButtonPlacementMode.Compact
member.summary:
The spin buttons have two visual states, depending on focus. By default, the spin buttons are displayed in a compact, vertical orientation. When the Numberbox gets focus, the spin buttons expand.
:::image type="content" source="./microsoft.ui.xaml.controls/images/controls/numberbox-spinbuttonplacementmode-compact.png" alt-text="NumberBox showing both visual states for Compact spin buttons":::

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NumberBoxSpinButtonPlacementMode.Hidden
member.summary: The spin buttons are not displayed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NumberBoxSpinButtonPlacementMode.Inline
member.summary:
The spin buttons are displayed in an expanded, horizontal orientation.
:::image type="content" source="./microsoft.ui.xaml.controls/images/controls/numberbox-spinbuttonplacementmode-inline.png" alt-text="NumberBox with Inline spin buttons":::

member.summary: Invoked when the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Page?text=Page> is loaded and becomes the current source of a parent <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame?text=Frame>.
member.param: Event data that can be examined by overriding code. The event data is representative of the pending navigation that will load the current <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Page?text=Page>. Usually the most relevant property to examine is <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs.Parameter?text=Parameter>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Page.OnNavigatingFrom(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs)
member.summary: Invoked immediately before the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Page?text=Page> is unloaded and is no longer the current source of a parent <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame?text=Frame>.
member.param: Event data that can be examined by overriding code. The event data is representative of the navigation that will unload the current <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Page?text=Page> unless canceled. The navigation can potentially be canceled by setting <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs.Cancel?text=Cancel>.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.PipsPager.MaxVisiblePips
member.summary: The maximum number of pips shown in the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.PipsPager?text=PipsPager> at one time.
member.returns:
The maximum number of pips shown in the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.PipsPager?text=PipsPager> at one time. The default value is 5.
When possible, the PipsPager always centers itself on the selected pip.
MaxVisiblePips should be set to a positive number. If set to 0, no pages will be visible to the user.

member.summary: The button is not visible and does not take up layout space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.PipsPagerButtonVisibility.Visible
member.summary: The navigation button is visible and enabled, but hidden when content is at one or the other extent. For example, the Previous button is hidden when the current page is the first page, and the Next button is hidden when the current page is the last page.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.PipsPagerButtonVisibility.VisibleOnPointerOver
member.summary: The button behavior is the same as Visible except the button is visible only when the pointer cursor is over the pager, or keyboard focus is inside the pager or on a navigation button.

member.param: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement?text=FrameworkElement> within the Pivot (such as a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock?text=TextBlock>) that is to be animated.
