member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the preferred location for positioning a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutBase?text=FlyoutBase> derived control relative to a visual element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.Auto
member.summary: Preferred location is determined automatically.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.Bottom
member.summary: Preferred location is below the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.BottomEdgeAlignedLeft
member.summary: Preferred location is below the target element, with the left edge of flyout aligned with left edge of the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.BottomEdgeAlignedRight
member.summary: Preferred location is below the target element, with the right edge of flyout aligned with right edge of the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.Full
member.summary: Preferred location is centered on the screen.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.Left
member.summary: Preferred location is to the left of the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.LeftEdgeAlignedBottom
member.summary: Preferred location is to the left of the target element, with the bottom edge of flyout aligned with bottom edge of the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.LeftEdgeAlignedTop
member.summary: Preferred location is to the left of the target element, with the top edge of flyout aligned with top edge of the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.Right
member.summary: Preferred location is to the right of the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.RightEdgeAlignedBottom
member.summary: Preferred location is to the right of the target element, with the bottom edge of flyout aligned with bottom edge of the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.RightEdgeAlignedTop
member.summary: Preferred location is to the right of the target element, with the top edge of flyout aligned with top edge of the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.Top
member.summary: Preferred location is above the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.TopEdgeAlignedLeft
member.summary: Preferred location is above the target element, with the left edge of flyout aligned with left edge of the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutPlacementMode.TopEdgeAlignedRight
member.summary: Preferred location is above the target element, with the right edge of flyout aligned with right edge of the target element.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how a flyout behaves when shown.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.Auto
member.summary: The show mode is determined automatically based on the method used to show the flyout.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.Standard
member.summary: Behavior is typical of a flyout shown reactively, like a context menu. The open flyout takes focus. For a CommandBarFlyout, it opens in it's expanded state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.Transient
member.summary: Behavior is typical of a flyout shown proactively. The open flyout does not take focus. For a CommandBarFlyout, it opens in it's collapsed state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.FlyoutShowMode.TransientWithDismissOnPointerMoveAway
member.summary: The flyout exhibits Transient behavior while the cursor is close to it, but is dismissed when the cursor moves away.

member.summary: Provides the appropriate background Brush for elements in the item template of a jump list to bind to. The Brush reflects the current theme and accent color, and it's also used to shade empty-group jump list items. By default, the Brush matches built-in apps, but you can override that to suit your design needs using the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.JumpListItemBackgroundConverter.Enabled?text=Enabled> and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.JumpListItemBackgroundConverter.Disabled?text=Disabled> properties.

member.summary: Returns the set of distances between irregular snap points for a specified orientation and alignment.

member.summary: Gets the distance between regular snap points for a specified orientation and alignment.
member.param: The orientation for the desired snap point set.

member.returns: The distance between the equidistant snap points. Returns 0 when no snap points are present.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the preferred location for positioning a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ToolTip?text=ToolTip> relative to a visual element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Bottom
member.summary: The preferred location of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ToolTip?text=ToolTip> is below the target element when element receives keyboard focus, at the bottom of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Left
member.summary: The preferred location of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ToolTip?text=ToolTip> is to the left of the target element when element receives keyboard focus, to the left of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Mouse
member.summary: The preferred location of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ToolTip?text=ToolTip> is with the top-left corner of the tooltip positioned at the mouse pointer location when hovered over with mouse, above the target element when focused with keyboard.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Right
member.summary: The preferred location of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ToolTip?text=ToolTip> is to the right of the target element when element receives keyboard focus, to the right of the mouse pointer when element is hovered over with pointer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PlacementMode.Top

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PopupPlacementMode.Top
member.summary: Preferred location is above the target element.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.PopupPlacementMode.TopEdgeAlignedRight

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.First

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeDecrement

The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?text=Thumb> moved to the left for a horizontal <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar> or upward for a vertical <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.LargeIncrement
member.summary: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?text=Thumb> moved a distance specified by the value of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.LargeChange?text=LargeChange>. member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.Last
member.summary: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?text=Thumb> moved to the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Maximum?text=Maximum> position of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.SmallDecrement
member.summary: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?text=Thumb> moved a distance specified by the value of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.SmallChange?text=SmallChange>. The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?text=Thumb> moved to the left for a horizontal <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar> or upward for a vertical <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.SmallIncrement
member.summary: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?text=Thumb> moved a distance specified by the value of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.SmallChange?text=SmallChange>. member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.ThumbPosition
member.summary: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?text=Thumb> moved to a new position because the user selected Scroll Here in the shortcut menu of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollEventType.ThumbTrack
member.summary: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?text=Thumb> was dragged and caused a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerMoved?text=PointerMoved> event. A <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar.Scroll?text=Scroll> event of this ScrollEventType may occur more than one time when the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.Thumb?text=Thumb> is dragged in the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>.

The default is a null brush from a pure code perspective, but the default control template for <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichEditBox?text=RichEditBox> applies a theme resource brush for this in a runtime instance of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichEditBox?text=RichEditBox> control.

member.returns: The brush used to highlight the selected text when <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichEditBox?text=RichEditBox> loses focus. The default is a null brush from a pure code perspective, but the default control template for <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichEditBox?text=RichEditBox> applies a Transparent brush for this in a runtime instance of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichEditBox?text=RichEditBox> control. To disable the SelectionHighlightColorWhenNotFocused, set the brush to Transparent once again.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility
member.summary: Defines constants that specify the visibility of a scrollbar within a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer> control.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Auto
member.summary:
A <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar> appears only when the viewport cannot display all of the content.
The dimension of the content is set to the corresponding dimension of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer> parent. For a horizontal <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>, the width of the content is set to the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportWidth?text=ViewportWidth> of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer>. For a vertical <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>, the height of the content is set to the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportHeight?text=ViewportHeight> of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Disabled
member.summary:
A <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar> does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content. Scrolling is disabled.
The dimension of the content is set to the corresponding dimension of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer> parent. For a horizontal <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>, the width of the content is set to the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportWidth?text=ViewportWidth> of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer>. For a vertical <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>, the height of the content is set to the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportHeight?text=ViewportHeight> of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Hidden
member.summary:
A <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar> does not appear even when the viewport cannot display all of the content. Scrolling is still enabled, and can occur through touch, keyboard, or mouse wheel interaction.
The dimension of the content is not affected by the dimension of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Visible
member.summary:
A <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar> always appears.
The dimension of the content is set to the corresponding dimension of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer> parent. For a horizontal <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>, the width of the content is set to the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportWidth?text=ViewportWidth> of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer>. For a vertical <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Primitives.ScrollBar?text=ScrollBar>, the height of the content is set to the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ViewportHeight?text=ViewportHeight> of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ChangeView(Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Single},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Causes the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer> to load a new view into the viewport using the specified offsets and zoom factor, and optionally disables scrolling animation.
member.param: A value between 0 and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ScrollableWidth?text=ScrollableWidth> that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled horizontally.
A value between 0 and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ScrollableHeight?text=ScrollableHeight> that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled vertically.

A value between <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.MinZoomFactor?text=MinZoomFactor> and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.MaxZoomFactor?text=MaxZoomFactor> that specifies the required target <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.MaxZoomFactor?text=ZoomFactor>.
true to disable zoom/pan animations while changing the view; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.returns: true if the view is changed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ChangeView(Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Single})
member.summary: Causes the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer> to load a new view into the viewport using the specified offsets and zoom factor.
member.param: A value between 0 and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ScrollableWidth?text=ScrollableWidth> that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled horizontally.
A value between 0 and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ScrollableHeight?text=ScrollableHeight> that specifies the distance the content should be scrolled vertically.

A value between <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.MinZoomFactor?text=MinZoomFactor> and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.MaxZoomFactor?text=MaxZoomFactor> that specifies the required target <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.MaxZoomFactor?text=ZoomFactor>.
member.returns: true if the view is changed; otherwise, false.

member.summary:
> [!NOTE] > ZoomToFactor may be altered or unavailable for releases after Windows 8.1. Instead, use <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.ChangeView(Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Double},Windows.Foundation.IReference{System.Single})?text=ChangeView>.

member.param: The zoom factor to set. The factors are based on a norm of 1.0, which represents no zoom applied. The values you can set are also influenced by current values for <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.MinZoomFactor?text=MinZoomFactor> and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer.MaxZoomFactor?text=MaxZoomFactor>.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom
member.summary: Represents a scrollable control that incorporates two views that have a semantic relationship. For example, the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.ZoomedOutView?text=ZoomedOutView> might be an index of titles, and the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.ZoomedInView?text=ZoomedInView> might include details and summaries for each of the title entries. Views can be changed using zoom or other interactions.

member.summary: Occurs when a view change is complete and the view is displayed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.ViewChangeStarted
member.summary: Occurs when a view change is requested.

member.summary: Changes from the current active view to the other possible view. For example, if <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.IsZoomedInViewActive?text=IsZoomedInViewActive> is true, calling this method changes to zoomed-out view.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.CanChangeViews
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that declares whether the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom?text=SemanticZoom> can change display views.
member.returns: true if views can be changed; otherwise, false. The default is true. <!--Seems like gets set to true via many UI event handlers. What is scenario for setting false or why does it ever get false? Locked because of data population?-->

member.returns: true if the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.ZoomedInView?text=ZoomedInView> is the active view. false if the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SemanticZoom.ZoomedOutView?text=ZoomedOutView> is the active view.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how panning snap points are processed for gesture/manipulation input. <!--This is a little guesswork.-->

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.Mandatory
member.summary: Content always stops at the snap point closest to where inertia would naturally stop along the direction of inertia.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.MandatorySingle
member.summary: Content always stops at the snap point closest to the release point along the direction of inertia.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.None
member.summary: No snapping behavior. Only the manipulation influences the final location.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.Optional
member.summary: Content stops at a snap point closest to where inertia would naturally stop along the direction of inertia, depending on how close the snap point is.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SnapPointsType.OptionalSingle
member.summary: Content stops at the next snap point, if the motion starts far from it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how the pane is shown in a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitView?text=SplitView>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.CompactInline
member.summary: The amount of the pane defined by the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitView.CompactPaneLength?text=CompactPaneLength> property is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The remaining part of the pane pushes the content to the side when it's open and takes up space in the control layout. The pane does not close when the user taps outside of it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.CompactOverlay
member.summary: The amount of the pane defined by the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitView.CompactPaneLength?text=CompactPaneLength> property is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The remaining part of the pane covers the content when it's open and does not take up space in the control layout. The pane closes when the user taps outside of it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.Inline
member.summary: The pane is shown side-by-side with the content and takes up space in the control layout. The pane does not close when the user taps outside of it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SplitViewDisplayMode.Overlay
member.summary: The pane covers the content when it's open and does not take up space in the control layout. The pane closes when the user taps outside of it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainBackgroundPanel

Implements a XAML layout surface target for Microsoft DirectX interoperation scenarios. This panel has some atypical restrictions on its usage within an app window; see Remarks.
> [!IMPORTANT] > SwapChainBackgroundPanel may be altered or unavailable for releases after Windows 8.1 Instead, use <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel?text=SwapChainPanel>.

member.summary:
> [!NOTE] > <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainBackgroundPanel?text=SwapChainBackgroundPanel> may be altered or unavailable for releases after Windows 8.1 Instead, use <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel?text=SwapChainPanel>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainBackgroundPanel?text=SwapChainBackgroundPanel> class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel
member.summary: Provides a hosting surface, where Microsoft DirectX swap chains provide content that can be rendered into a XAML UI. A SwapChainPanel element is a key component for an app that renders Microsoft DirectX graphics and then presents those visuals within a XAML page.

member.summary: Occurs when the composition scale factor of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel?text=SwapChainPanel> has changed.

member.summary: Creates a core input object that handles the input types as specified by the deviceKinds parameter. This core input object can process input events on a background thread.
member.param: A combined value of the enumeration.
member.returns: An object that represents the input subsystem for interop purposes and which can be used for input event connection points.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.SwapChainPanel.CompositionScaleX

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabView
member.summary:
The TabView control is a way to display a set of tabs and their respective content. Tab controls are useful for displaying several pages (or documents) of content while giving a user the capability to rearrange, open, or close new tabs.
**Is this the right control?**
Use a TabView to help the user manage multiple app pages or documents within the same window.
Do not use a TabView to display a static set of tabs that the user cannot rearrange, open, or close. Use a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NavigationView?text=NavigationView> (<xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.NavigationViewPaneDisplayMode?text=NavigationViewPaneDisplayMode> of Top) instead.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewCloseButtonOverlayMode
member.summary: Defines constants that describe the behavior of the close button contained within each <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewItem?text=TabViewItem>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewCloseButtonOverlayMode.Always
member.summary: The selected tab always shows the close button if it is closable. Unselected tabs always show the close button if they are closable.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewCloseButtonOverlayMode.Auto
member.summary:
Behavior is defined by the framework. Default.
This value maps to Always.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewCloseButtonOverlayMode.OnPointerOver
member.summary: The selected tab always shows the close button if it is closable. Unselected tabs show the close button when the tab is closable and the user has their pointer over the tab.

member.summary: Defines constants that specify the width of the tabs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewWidthMode.Compact
member.summary: Unselected tabs collapse to show only their icon. The selected tab adjusts to display the content within the tab.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewWidthMode.Equal
member.summary: Each tab has the same width.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TabViewWidthMode.SizeToContent
member.summary: Each tab adjusts its width to the content within the tab.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTip
member.summary: A teaching tip is a notification flyout used to provide contextually relevant information. It supports rich content (including titles, subtitles, icons, images, and text) and can be configured for either explicit or light-dismiss.

member.summary:

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.Auto
member.summary: Along the bottom side of the xaml root when non-targeted and above the target element when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.Bottom
member.summary: Along the bottom side of the xaml root when non-targeted and below the target element when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.BottomLeft
member.summary: The bottom left corner of the xaml root when non-targeted and below the target element expanding leftward when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.BottomRight
member.summary: The bottom right corner of the xaml root when non-targeted and below the target element expanding rightward when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.Center
member.summary: The center of the xaml root when non-targeted and pointing at the center of the target element when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.Left
member.summary: Along the left side of the xaml root when non-targeted and left of the target element when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.LeftBottom
member.summary: The bottom left corner of the xaml root when non-targeted and left of the target element expanding downward when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.LeftTop
member.summary: The top left corner of the xaml root when non-targeted and left of the target element expanding upward when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.Right
member.summary: Along the right side of the xaml root when non-targeted and right of the target element when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.RightBottom
member.summary: The bottom right corner of the xaml root when non-targeted and right of the target element expanding downward when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.RightTop
member.summary: The top right corner of the xaml root when non-targeted and right of the target element expanding upward when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.Top
member.summary: Along the top side of the xaml root when non-targeted and above the target element when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.TopLeft
member.summary: The top left corner of the xaml root when non-targeted and above the target element expanding leftward when targeted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TeachingTipPlacementMode.TopRight

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TextBlock.Foreground
member.summary: Gets or sets the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Brush?text=Brush> to apply to the text contents of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TextBlock?text=TextBlock>.

The default is a null brush from a pure code perspective, but the default control template for <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TextBox?text=TextBox> applies a Transparent brush for this in a runtime instance of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TextBox?text=TextBox> control. To disable the SelectionHighlightColorWhenNotFocused, set the brush to Transparent once again.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are aligned on the non-scrolling or non-virtualizing axis.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.Center
member.summary: Items are aligned in the center of the row or column, with extra space at the start and end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.End
member.summary: Items are aligned with the end of the row or column, with extra space at the start. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceAround
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly before and after each item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceBetween
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly between adjacent items. No space is added at the start or end.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.SpaceEvenly
member.summary: Items are aligned so that extra space is added evenly before and after each item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsJustification.Start
member.summary: Items are aligned with the start of the row or column, with extra space at the end. Spacing between items does not change.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how items are sized to fill the available space in a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayout?text=UniformGridLayout>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.Fill
member.summary: The item is sized to fill the available space in the non-scrolling direction. Item size in the scrolling direction is not changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.None
member.summary: The item retains its natural size. Use of extra space is determined by the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayout.ItemsJustification?text=ItemsJustification> property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.UniformGridLayoutItemsStretch.Uniform
member.summary: The item is sized to both fill the available space in the non-scrolling direction and maintain its aspect ratio.

member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own "Measure" pass behavior.
member.param: The context object that facilitates communication between the layout and its host container.

member.summary: Explicitly triggers initialization of the control's CoreWebView2.
member.returns: A Task that represents the background initialization process. When the task completes then the CoreWebView2 property will be available for use (non-null). Note that the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.WebView2.CoreWebView2Initialized?text=CoreWebView2Initialized> event will be invoked before the task completes or on exceptions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.WebView2.EnsureCoreWebView2Async(Microsoft.Web.WebView2.Core.CoreWebView2Environment,Microsoft.Web.WebView2.Core.CoreWebView2ControllerOptions)
member.summary: Explicitly triggers initialization of the control's CoreWebView2 with the specified environment and controller options.
member.param: A pre-created CoreWebView2Environment that should be used to create the CoreWebView2. Creating your own environment gives you control over several options that affect how the CoreWebView2 is initialized. If you pass null then a default environment will be created and used automatically.

A pre-created CoreWebView2ControllerOptions that should be used to create the CoreWebView2. Creating your own controller options gives you control over several options that affect how the CoreWebView2 is initialized. If you pass a controllerOptions to this method then it will override any settings specified on the CreationProperties and no value has been set to CreationProperties then a default controllerOptions will be created and used automatically.
member.returns: An asynchronous action that represents the background initialization process. When it completes the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.WebView2.CoreWebView2?text=CoreWebView2> property will be available for use (i.e., non-null).

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.WebView2.EnsureCoreWebView2Async(Microsoft.Web.WebView2.Core.CoreWebView2Environment)

member.param: A pre-created CoreWebView2Environment that should be used to create the CoreWebView2. Creating your own environment gives you control over several options that affect how the CoreWebView2 is initialized. If you pass null then a default environment will be created and used automatically.
member.returns: An asynchronous action that represents the background initialization process. When it completes the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.WebView2.CoreWebView2?text=CoreWebView2> property will be available for use (i.e., non-null).

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingOperations
member.summary: Provides the static <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingOperations.SetBinding(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.BindingBase)?text=SetBinding> method.

member.summary: Associates a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding?text=Binding> with a target property on a target object. This method is the code equivalent to using a {Binding} markup extension in XAML markup.
member.param: The object that should be the target of the evaluated binding.

The property on the target to bind, specified by its identifier. These identifiers are usually available as static read-only properties on the type that defines the target object, or one of its base types. You can also bind to attached properties, but see Remarks.

The binding to assign to the target property. This <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding?text=Binding> should be initialized: important <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding?text=Binding> properties such as <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding.Path?text=Path> should already be set before passing it as the parameter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DataContextChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.DataContextChanged?text=DataContextChanged> event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DataContextChangedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that influences whether another <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DataContextChangedEventArgs?text=DataContextChanged> event should be fired from child elements that inherit the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.DataContext?text=DataContext> value and detect that the value has changed.
member.returns: true to prevent further <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DataContextChangedEventArgs?text=DataContextChanged> events from being fired for each child <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement?text=FrameworkElement> that inherits the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.DataContext?text=DataContext> value. You would do this to indicate to other handlers that the necessary logic for responding to the data context change has already been performed. false to permit the event to be fired by each immediate child <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement?text=FrameworkElement> in the element tree that detects a change to the inherited <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.DataContext?text=DataContext> value. The default is false.

member.summary: Gets the new <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.DataContext?text=DataContext> value for the element where the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.DataContextChanged?text=DataContextChanged> event fired.
member.returns: An object representing the new <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.DataContext?text=DataContext> value for the element where the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.DataContextChanged?text=DataContextChanged> event fired.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.BindingFailed
member.summary: Occurs when a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding?text=Binding> cannot be resolved.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.XamlResourceReferenceFailed
member.summary: Occurs when a reference to a XAML resource cannot be resolved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.EnableFrameRateCounter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to display frame-rate and per-frame CPU usage info. These display as an overlay of counters in the window chrome while the app runs.
member.returns: true to display the overlay debug counters; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.FailFastOnErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether XAML errors cause an immediate FailFast rather than returning an error.
member.returns: true if XAML errors cause an immediate FailFast rather than returning an error; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.IsBindingTracingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to engage the binding tracing feature of Microsoft Visual Studio when the app runs. When engaged and a binding error occurs, the BindingFailed event is raised and error information is logged in the native debug output.
member.returns: true to engage the binding tracing feature of Microsoft Visual Studio; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.IsTextPerformanceVisualizationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to engage the text performance visualization feature of Microsoft Visual Studio when the app runs.
member.returns: true to engage the text performance visualization feature of Microsoft Visual Studio; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.IsXamlResourceReferenceTracingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to engage the XAML resource reference tracing feature of Microsoft Visual Studio when the app runs. When engaged and a XAML resource reference error occurs, the XamlResourceReferenceFailed event is raised and error information is logged in the native debug output.
member.returns: true to engage the XAML resource reference tracing feature of Microsoft Visual Studio; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.LayoutCycleDebugBreakLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the level of layout cycle tracing events that trigger a debugger breakpoint.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration that indicates the level of layout cycle tracing events that trigger a debugger breakpoint. The default is None.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DebugSettings.LayoutCycleTracingLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether layout cycle tracing is written to the native debugger and the level of detail that is recorded.
member.returns: A value of the enumeration that indicates whether layout cycle tracing is written to the native debugger and the level of detail that is recorded. The default is None.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty
member.summary: Represents a dependency property that is registered with the dependency property system. Dependency properties provide support for value expressions, data binding, animation, and property change notification. For more info on how DependencyProperty values serve as identifiers for dependency properties, see Dependency properties overview.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty.GetMetadata(Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName)
member.summary: Retrieves the property metadata value for the dependency property as registered to a type. You specify the type you want info from as a type reference.
member.param: The name of the specific type from which to retrieve the dependency property metadata, as a type reference (System.Type.
member.returns: A property metadata object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty.Register(System.String,Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.PropertyMetadata)
member.summary: Registers a dependency property with the specified property name, property type, owner type, and property metadata for the property. Use this method when defining or initializing a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject?text=DependencyObject> derived class that will own the registered dependency property.
member.param: The name of the dependency property to register.
The type of the property, as a type reference (System.Type.
The owner type that is registering the dependency property, as a type reference (System.Type.

A property metadata instance. This can contain a default value and a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.PropertyChangedCallback?text=PropertyChangedCallback> implementation reference. Passing null for this parameter is equivalent to passing a new PropertyMetadata instance created by calling <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.PropertyMetadata.Create(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.CreateDefaultValueCallback)?text=PropertyMetadata.Create> with null as the default value parameter.
member.returns: A dependency property identifier that typically is stored in a public static read-only field in your <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject?text=DependencyObject> derived class. The identifier is then used both by your own code and any third-party user code to reference the dependency property later, for operations such as setting its value programmatically or attaching a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding?text=Binding> in code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty.RegisterAttached(System.String,Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,Windows.UI.Xaml.Interop.TypeName,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.PropertyMetadata)
member.summary: Registers an attached dependency property with the specified property name, property type, owner type, and property metadata for the property.
member.param: The name of the dependency property to register.
The type of the property, as a type reference (System.Type.
The owner type that is registering the dependency property, as a type reference (System.Type.
A property metadata instance. This can contain a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.PropertyChangedCallback?text=PropertyChangedCallback> implementation reference.
member.returns: A dependency property identifier that should be used to set the value of a public static read-only field in your class. That identifier is then used to reference the attached property later, for operations such as setting its value programmatically or attaching a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Data.Binding?text=Binding>.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyProperty.UnsetValue
member.summary: Specifies a static value that is used by the property system rather than null to indicate that the property exists, but does not have its value set by the property system or by any app code.
member.returns: The sentinel value for an unset value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Documents.TextPointer.GetPositionAtOffset(System.Int32,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Documents.LogicalDirection)
member.summary: Returns a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Documents.TextPointer?text=TextPointer> to the position indicated by the specified offset, in symbols, from the beginning of the current <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Documents.TextPointer?text=TextPointer> and in the specified direction.
member.param: An offset, in symbols, for which to calculate and return the position. If the offset is negative, the returned <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Documents.TextPointer?text=TextPointer> precedes the current <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Documents.TextPointer?text=TextPointer>; otherwise, it follows.

One of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Documents.LogicalDirection?text=LogicalDirection> values that specifies the logical direction of the returned <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Documents.TextPointer?text=TextPointer>.
member.returns: A <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Documents.TextPointer?text=TextPointer> to the position indicated by the specified offset and in the direction specified by the direction parameter, or null if the offset extends past the end of the content.

member.summary: Gets the logical direction associated with the current position, which is used to disambiguate content associated with the current position.
member.returns: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Documents.LogicalDirection?text=LogicalDirection> value that is associated with the current position.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.Add(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration)
member.summary: Adds the TimeSpan component of two <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> values. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use the Addition method instead.

The value to add.
member.returns: The resulting <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> after TimeSpan component addition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.Compare(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration)
member.summary: Compares value equality of two <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> structures. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use Duration.Compare instead.
member.param: The first <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> to compare.
The second <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> to compare.
member.returns: If duration1 is less than duration2, a negative value that represents the difference. If duration1 is equal to duration2, zero. If duration1 is greater than duration2, a positive value that represents the difference.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.Equals(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration)
member.summary: Determines whether two <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> values have equivalent values. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use the Equality method instead.
member.param: The first <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> to compare.
The second <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> to compare.
member.returns: true if target and value hold equivalent values; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.FromTimeSpan(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a new <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> based on a TimeSpan constructor instead.
member.param: The initializing TimeSpan.
member.returns: The created <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration>.

member.summary: Returns whether the TimeSpan component of a given <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> holds a non-null value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use Duration.HasTimeSpan instead.

member.returns: true if the TimeSpan component of the provided <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> is not null; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals
member.summary: Describes the capital letter style value for the Typography.Capitals attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.AllPetiteCaps
member.summary: Both capital and lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height. Petite capitals are smaller than small capitals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.AllSmallCaps
member.summary: Both capital and lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.Normal
member.summary: Capital letters render normally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.PetiteCaps
member.summary: Lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height. Petite capitals are smaller than small capitals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.SmallCaps
member.summary: Lowercase letters are replaced with a glyph form of an uppercase letter with the same approximate height.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.Titling
member.summary: Glyph forms are substituted with a typographic form specifically designed for titles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontCapitals.Unicase
member.summary: Capital letters display in unicase. Unicase fonts render both uppercase and lowercase letters in a mixture of uppercase and lowercase glyphs determined by the type designer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for selecting font-specific versions of glyphs for a specified East Asian writing system or language.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.HojoKanji
member.summary: Replaces default glyphs with the corresponding forms from the Hojo Kanji specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis04
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS04 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis78
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS78 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis83
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS83 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Jis90
member.summary: Replaces default Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS90 specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.NlcKanji
member.summary: Replaces default glyphs with the corresponding forms from the NLC Kanji specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Normal
member.summary: No font-specific glyph versions are applied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Simplified
member.summary: Replaces traditional Chinese or Japanese forms with their corresponding simplified forms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.Traditional
member.summary: Replaces simplified Chinese or Japanese forms with their corresponding traditional forms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianLanguage.TraditionalNames
member.summary: Replaces simplified Kanji forms with their corresponding traditional forms. This glyph set is explicitly limited to the traditional forms considered proper for use in personal names.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for selecting glyphs of different width styles.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Full
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with full width (usually em) glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Half
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with half width (half em) glyphs

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Normal
member.summary: Default width style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Proportional
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with proportionally spaced glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Quarter
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with one-quarter width (one-quarter em) glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontEastAsianWidths.Third
member.summary: Replaces uniform width glyphs with one-third width (one-third em) glyphs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontFraction
member.summary: Describes a fraction style value for the Typography.Fraction attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontFraction.Normal
member.summary: Default style is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontFraction.Slashed
member.summary: Stacked fraction style is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontFraction.Stacked
member.summary: Slashed fraction style is used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralAlignment
member.summary: Describes the numeral alignment value for the Typography.NumeralAlignment attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralAlignment.Normal
member.summary: Default numeral alignment is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralAlignment.Proportional
member.summary: Proportional width alignment is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralAlignment.Tabular
member.summary: Tabular alignment is used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle
member.summary: Describes a numeral style value for the Typography.NumeralStyle attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle.Lining
member.summary: Lining numeral style is used. Replaces default glyphs with numeric forms of even height.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle.Normal
member.summary: Default numeral style is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontNumeralStyle.OldStyle
member.summary: Old style numeral style is used. Replaces default glyphs with a figure style that matches lowercase letters in height and color.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants
member.summary: Describes a font variant value for the Typography.Variants attached property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Inferior
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with an inferior glyph, or it might combine glyph substitution with positioning adjustments for proper placement. Inferior forms are typically used in chemical formulas or mathematical notation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Normal
member.summary: Default font behavior. Font scaling and positioning is normal.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Ordinal
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with an ordinal glyph, or it might combine glyph substitution with positioning adjustments for proper placement. Ordinal forms are normally associated with numeric notation of an ordinal word, such as "1st" for "first".

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Ruby
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a smaller Japanese Kana glyph. This is used to clarify the meaning of Kanji, which might be unfamiliar to the reader.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Subscript
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a subscript glyph.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FontVariants.Superscript
member.summary: Replaces a default glyph with a superscript glyph. Superscript is commonly used for footnotes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement
member.summary: Provides a base element class for Windows Runtime UI objects. FrameworkElement defines common API that support UI interaction and the automatic layout system. FrameworkElement also defines API related to data binding, defining and examining the object tree, and tracking object lifetime.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.ActualThemeChanged

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.GoToElementStateCore(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, enables per-state construction of a visual tree for a control template in code, rather than by loading XAML for all states at control startup.
member.param: The state to transition to.

true to use a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.VisualTransition?text=VisualTransition> to transition between states. false to skip using transitions and go directly to the requested state. The default is false.
member.returns: true if the control successfully transitions to the new state, or was already using that state; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.MeasureOverride(Windows.Foundation.Size)
member.summary: Provides the behavior for the "Measure" pass of the layout cycle. Classes can override this method to define their own "Measure" pass behavior.
member.param: The available size that this object can give to child objects. Infinity can be specified as a value to indicate that the object will size to whatever content is available.
member.returns: The size that this object determines it needs during layout, based on its calculations of the allocated sizes for child objects or based on other considerations such as a fixed container size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.OnApplyTemplate
member.summary: Invoked whenever application code or internal processes (such as a rebuilding layout pass) call <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control.ApplyTemplate?text=ApplyTemplate>. In simplest terms, this means the method is called just before a UI element displays in your app. Override this method to influence the default post-template logic of a class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.FlowDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction in which text and other UI elements flow within any parent element that controls their layout. This property can be set to either LeftToRight or RightToLeft. Setting FlowDirection to RightToLeft on any element sets the alignment to the right, the reading order to right-to-left and the layout of the control to flow from right to left.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason
member.summary: Specifies values that represent reasons that a Windows.UI.Xaml.UIElement got focus in a desktop application that uses a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.DesktopWindowXamlSource?text=DesktopWindowXamlSource> object to host XAML-based UI.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Down
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating down by using 4-direction navigation, such as pressing keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.First
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating to the next element by using bidirectional navigation, such as pressing Tab.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Last
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating to the previous element by using bidirectional navigation, such as pressing Shift-Tab.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Left
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating left by using 4-direction navigation, such as pressing keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Programmatic
member.summary: The focus was set programmatically.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Restore
member.summary: The focus was restored after a task switch, such as pressing Alt + Tab.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Right
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating right by using 4-direction navigation, such as pressing keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason.Up
member.summary: The focus was set in response to the user navigating up by using 4-direction navigation, such as pressing keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest
member.summary: Provides information about a focus request for a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.DesktopWindowXamlSource?text=DesktopWindowXamlSource> object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest.#ctor(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason,Windows.Foundation.Rect,System.Guid)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest?text=XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest> class with the reason for the navigation request, the bounding rectangle that will receive navigation focus, and the unique correlation ID for the request.
Initializes a new instance of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest?text=XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest> object for the the specified navigation request reason, the bounding rectangle that will receive navigation focus, and the unique correlation ID for the request.
member.param: The reason for the navigation request.

The bounding rectangle of the element in the desktop application that is losing focus (that is, the element that had focus before the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.DesktopWindowXamlSource?text=DesktopWindowXamlSource> received focus). This parameter is used to provide context to the WinUI XAML framework when the user enters the DesktopWindowXamlSource using a 4-direction navigation experience, such as the keyboard arrow keys.

The unique identifier for the navigation request. You can use this parameter for logging purposes, or if you have an existing correlation ID from an in-progress focus movement already in progress and you want to connect that focus movement with the current navigation request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest.#ctor(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest?text=XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest> object for the the specified navigation request reason and the bounding rectangle that will receive navigation focus.
member.param: The reason for the navigation request.

The bounding rectangle of the element in the desktop application that is losing focus (that is, the element that had focus before the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.DesktopWindowXamlSource?text=DesktopWindowXamlSource> received focus). This parameter is used to provide context to the WinUI XAML framework when the user enters the DesktopWindowXamlSource using a 4-direction navigation experience, such as the keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest.#ctor(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationReason)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest?text=XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest> object for the the specified navigation request reason.
member.param: The reason for the navigation request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest.CorrelationId
member.summary: Gets the unique ID generated when a focus movement event is initiated.
member.returns: The unique ID generated when a focus movement event is initiated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Hosting.XamlSourceFocusNavigationRequest.HintRect
member.summary: Gets the bounding rectangle used to identify the focus candidates most likely to receive navigation focus.
member.returns: The bounding rectangle used to identify the focus candidates most likely to receive navigation focus.

member.summary: Gets the x- and y-coordinates of the pointer position, optionally evaluated against a coordinate origin of a supplied <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement>.
member.param: Any <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement>-derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overall coordinate system, use a relativeTo value of null.

A Point that represents the current x- and y-coordinates of the mouse pointer position. If null was passed as relativeTo, this coordinate is for the overall window. If a relativeTo value other than null was passed, this coordinate is relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.
member.returns: true if the context request was initiated by a pointer device; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager
member.summary: A helper class that enables global management of focus actions and events across all elements in an application.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.GettingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before an element actually receives focus. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.GotFocus
member.summary: Occurs when an element within a container element (a focus scope) receives focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus might move before bubbling is complete.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.LosingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before focus moves from the current element with focus to the target element. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.LostFocus
member.summary: Occurs when an element within a container element (a focus scope) loses focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus might move again before bubbling is complete.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindFirstFocusableElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Retrieves the first element that can receive focus based on the specified scope.
member.param: The root object from which to search. If null, the search scope is the current window.
member.returns: The first focusable object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindLastFocusableElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Retrieves the last element that can receive focus based on the specified scope.
member.param: The root object from which to search. If null, the search scope is the current window.
member.returns: The last focusable object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FindNextElementOptions)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction (cannot be used with tab navigation, see remarks).
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
The options to help identify the next element to receive focus with keyboard/controller/remote navigation.
member.returns: The next object to receive focus.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
member.returns: The next object to receive focus.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextFocusableElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction and hint rectangle.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.

A bounding rectangle used to influence which element is most likely to be considered the next to receive focus. Examples where this can be useful include:
- When no element currently has focus, specifying a small rectangle at a screen location of (-1, -1) starts focus from the upper left corner of the display. - In a program guide where you want to ensure programs at the current time receive focus. (The focus algorithm might favor shows at a later time based on a number of factors.)
member.returns: null if focus cannot be set in the specified direction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.FindNextFocusableElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection)
member.summary: Retrieves the element that should receive focus based on the specified navigation direction.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the application UI.
member.returns: null if focus cannot be set in the specified direction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.GetFocusedElement
member.summary: Retrieves the element in the UI that has focus.
member.returns: The object that has focus. Typically, this is a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control?text=Control> class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.GetFocusedElement(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.XamlRoot)
member.summary: Retrieves the focused element within the XAML island container.
member.returns: The object that has focus. Typically, this is a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.Control?text=Control> class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.TryFocusAsync(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FocusState)
member.summary: Asynchronously attempts to set focus on an element when the application is initialized.
member.param: The object on which to set focus.
One of the values from the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FocusState?text=FocusState> enumeration that specify how an element can obtain focus.
member.returns: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusMovementResult?text=FocusMovementResult> that indicates whether focus was successfully set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.TryMoveFocus(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FindNextElementOptions)
member.summary: Attempts to change focus from the element with focus to the next focusable element in the specified direction, using the specified navigation options.
member.param: The direction to traverse (in tab order).
The options to help identify the next element to receive focus with keyboard/controller/remote navigation.
member.returns: true if focus moved; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.TryMoveFocus(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection)
member.summary: Attempts to change focus from the element with focus to the next focusable element in the specified direction.
member.param: The direction to traverse (in tab order).
member.returns: true if focus moved; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.TryMoveFocusAsync(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FindNextElementOptions)
member.summary: Asynchronously attempts to change focus from the current element with focus to the next focusable element in the specified direction and subject to the specified navigation options.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
The navigation options used to identify the focus candidate.
member.returns: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusMovementResult?text=FocusMovementResult> that indicates whether focus was successfully set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusManager.TryMoveFocusAsync(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusNavigationDirection)
member.summary: Asynchronously attempts to change focus from the current element with focus to the next focusable element in the specified direction.
member.param: The direction that focus moves from element to element within the app UI.
member.returns: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.FocusMovementResult?text=FocusMovementResult> that indicates whether focus was successfully set.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator
member.summary:
Represents a keyboard shortcut (or accelerator) that lets a user perform an action using the keyboard instead of navigating the app UI (directly or through access keys).
Accelerators are typically assigned to buttons or menu items.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.Invoked
member.summary: Occurs when the key combination for this <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator?text=KeyboardAccelerator> is pressed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator?text=KeyboardAccelerator> class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a keyboard shortcut (accelerator) is available to the user.
member.returns: true if the shortcut is available; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.IsEnabledProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.IsEnabled?text=IsEnabled> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.IsEnabled?text=IsEnabled> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.Key
member.summary:
Gets or sets the virtual-key (used in conjunction with one or more modifier keys) for a keyboard shortcut (accelerator).
A keyboard shortcut is invoked when the modifier keys associated with the shortcut are pressed and then the non-modifier key is pressed at the same time. For example, Ctrl+C for copy and Ctrl+S for save.
member.returns: The virtual-key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.KeyProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.Key?text=Key> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.Key?text=Key> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.Modifiers
member.summary:
Gets or sets the virtual-key used to modify another keypress for a keyboard shortcut (accelerator).
A keyboard shortcut is invoked when the modifier keys associated with the shortcut are pressed and then the non-modifier key is pressed at the same time. For example, Ctrl+C for copy and Ctrl+S for save.
member.returns: The virtual-key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.ModifiersProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.Modifiers?text=Modifiers> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.Modifiers?text=Modifiers> dependency property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the scope (or target) of the keyboard accelerator.
member.returns: The scope (or target) of the keyboard accelerator. The default is null (global scope).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.ScopeOwnerProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.ScopeOwner?text=ScopeOwner> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator.ScopeOwner?text=ScopeOwner> dependency property.

member.summary: Provides event data for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.KeyUp?text=KeyUp> and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.KeyDown?text=KeyDown> routed events.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyRoutedEventArgs.DeviceId
member.summary: Gets a unique ID for the input device that generated this key event (not supported for all input devices).
member.returns: A unique identifier for the input device associated with the key event, or an empty string for an unsupported device. The same device can be assigned a different ID each time it is connected.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyRoutedEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled. A true value for Handled prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: true to mark the routed event handled; false to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyRoutedEventArgs.Key
member.summary:
Gets the virtual-key associated with the event.
Depending on the input device, this can be a mapped value. For raw, unmapped event data, see the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyRoutedEventArgs.OriginalKey?text=OriginalKey> property.
member.returns: A system value that indicates the code for the key referenced by the event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyRoutedEventArgs.KeyStatus
member.summary: Gets a structure value that reports various system-detected characteristics of the key press, including repeat count and menu status.
member.returns: A structure value with flags that report status.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyRoutedEventArgs.OriginalKey
member.summary:
Gets the original, unmapped virtual-key associated with the event.
Depending on the input device, the input button might be mapped to a different key value. For the mapped event value, see the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyRoutedEventArgs.Key?text=Key> property.
member.returns: A system value that indicates the code for the key referenced by the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes
member.summary: Specifies how a target UI element interprets manipulation events. This enumeration is flagwise, so you can set multiple modes for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationMode?text=ManipulationMode> property.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.All
member.summary: Enable all manipulation interaction modes except those supported through Direct Manipulation

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.None
member.summary: Do not present graphic interaction with manipulation events.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.Rotate
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that rotate the target.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.RotateInertia
member.summary: Apply inertia to rotate actions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.Scale
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that scale the target.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.ScaleInertia
member.summary: Apply inertia to scale actions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.System
member.summary: Enable system-driven touch interactions supported through Direct Manipulation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.TranslateInertia
member.summary: Apply inertia to translate actions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.TranslateRailsX
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that translate the target on the X axis but using a rails mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.TranslateRailsY
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that translate the target on the Y axis but using a rails mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.TranslateX
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that translate the target on the X axis.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ManipulationModes.TranslateY
member.summary: Permit manipulation actions that translate the target on the Y axis.
