member.summary: Represents the method that will handle pointer message events such as <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerPressed?text=PointerPressed>.
member.param: The object where the event handler is attached.
Event data for the event.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs
member.summary: Contains the arguments returned by the last pointer event message.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.GetCurrentPoint(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Input.PointerPoint?text=PointerPoint> object that provides basic info about the pointer associated with the event.
member.param: Any <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement>-derived object that is connected to the same object tree. To specify the object relative to the overall coordinate system, use a relativeTo value of null.
member.returns: A <xref:Microsoft.UI.Input.PointerPoint?text=PointerPoint> value that represents the pointer point associated with this event. If null was passed as relativeTo, the coordinates are in the frame of reference of the overall window. If a relativeTo value other than null was passed, the coordinates are relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.GetIntermediatePoints(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Input.PointerPoint?text=PointerPoint> objects that represent the pointer history from the last pointer event up to and including the current pointer event. Each <xref:Microsoft.UI.Input.PointerPoint?text=PointerPoint> in the collection provides basic info about the pointer associated with the event. The last item in the collection is equivalent to the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Input.PointerPoint?text=PointerPoint> object returned by <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.PointerRoutedEventArgs.GetCurrentPoint(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)?text=GetCurrentPoint>.
member.param: Provides the context for the pointer data. Can be any <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement>-derived object that is connected to the same object tree. If null, location coordinates are in the context of the app.
member.returns: The collection of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Input.PointerPoint?text=PointerPoint> objects corresponding to the pointer history associated with the event. If relativeTo is null, location coordinates are in the context of the app. Otherwise, the coordinates are relative to the object referenced by relativeTo.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that marks the routed event as handled, and prevents most handlers along the event route from handling the same event again.
member.returns: true to mark the routed event handled. false to leave the routed event unhandled, which permits the event to potentially route further and be acted on by other handlers. The default is false.

member.returns: true to mark the event handled. false to leave the event unhandled. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ProcessKeyboardAcceleratorEventArgs.Key
member.summary:
Gets the virtual-key (used in conjunction with one or more modifier keys) for a keyboard shortcut (accelerator).
A keyboard shortcut is invoked when the modifier keys associated with the shortcut are pressed and then the non-modifier key is pressed at the same time. For example, Ctrl+C for copy and Ctrl+S for save.
member.returns: The virtual-key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.ProcessKeyboardAcceleratorEventArgs.Modifiers
member.summary:
Gets the virtual-key used to modify another keypress for a keyboard shortcut (accelerator).
A keyboard shortcut is invoked when the modifier keys associated with the shortcut are pressed and then the non-modifier key is pressed at the same time. For example, Ctrl+C for copy and Ctrl+S for save.
member.returns: The virtual-key.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode
member.summary: Specifies the 2D directional navigation behavior when using the keyboard arrow keys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode.Auto
member.summary: Behavior is inherited from the elements ancestors. If all ancestors have a value of Auto, the fallback behavior is Disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode.Disabled
member.summary: Arrow keys cannot be used for 2D directional navigation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode.Enabled
member.summary: Arrow keys can be used for 2D directional navigation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy
member.summary:
Specifies the disambiguation strategy used for navigating between multiple candidate targets using <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.XYFocusDownNavigationStrategy?text=XYFocusDownNavigationStrategy>, <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.XYFocusLeftNavigationStrategy?text=XYFocusLeftNavigationStrategy>, <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.XYFocusRightNavigationStrategy?text=XYFocusRightNavigationStrategy>, and <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.XYFocusUpNavigationStrategy?text=XYFocusUpNavigationStrategy>.
> [!NOTE] > Other factors, such as the previously focused element or proximity to the axis of the navigation direction, can influence the navigation end result.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.Auto
member.summary: Indicates that navigation strategy is inherited from the element's ancestors. If all ancestors have a value of Auto, the fallback strategy is Projection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.NavigationDirectionDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the element closest to the axis of the navigation direction. The edge of the bounding rect corresponding to the navigation direction is extended and projected to identify candidate targets. The first element encountered is identified as the target. In the case of multiple candidates, the closest element is identified as the target. If there are still multiple candidates, the topmost/leftmost element is identified as the candidate. Focus moves from A to C and then from C to B on down navigation

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.Projection
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the first element encountered when projecting the edge of the currently focused element in the direction of navigation. Focus moves from A to D on down navigation based on projection of the bottom edge of A

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategy.RectilinearDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the closest element based on the shortest 2D distance (Manhattan metric). This distance is calculated by adding the primary distance and the secondary distance of each potential candidate. In the case of a tie: - The first element to the left is selected if the navigation direction is up or down - The first element to the top is selected if the navigation direction is left or right Here we show how focus moves from A to B based on rectilinear distance. - Distance (A, B, Down) = 10 + 0 = 10 - Distance (A, C, Down) = 0 + 30 = 30 - Distance (A, D, Down) 30 + 0 = 30 Focus moves from A to B based on rectilinear distance

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride
member.summary:
Specifies how the XAML framework determines the target of an XY navigation.
Overrides <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusKeyboardNavigationMode?text=XYFocusKeyboardNavigationStrategyMode>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.Auto
member.summary: Indicates that navigation strategy is inherited from the element's ancestors. If all ancestors have a value of Auto, the fallback strategy is Projection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.NavigationDirectionDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the element closest to the axis of the navigation direction. The edge of the bounding rect corresponding to the navigation direction is extended and projected to identify candidate targets. The first element encountered is identified as the target. In the case of multiple candidates, the closest element is identified as the target. If there are still multiple candidates, the topmost/leftmost element is identified as the candidate. Focus moves from A to C and then from C to B on down navigation

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.None
member.summary: No navigation override is applied.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.Projection
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the first element encountered when projecting the edge of the currently focused element in the direction of navigation. > [!NOTE] > Other factors, such as the previously focused element and proximity to the axis of the navigation direction, can influence the result. Focus moves from A to D on down navigation based on projection of the bottom edge of A

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.XYFocusNavigationStrategyOverride.RectilinearDistance
member.summary: Indicates that focus moves to the closest element based on the shortest 2D distance (Manhattan metric). This distance is calculated by adding the primary distance and the secondary distance of each potential candidate. In the case of a tie: - The first element to the left is selected if the navigation direction is up or down - The first element to the top is selected if the navigation direction is left or right Here we show how focus moves from A to B based on rectilinear distance. - Distance (A, B, Down) = 10 + 0 = 10 - Distance (A, C, Down) = 0 + 30 = 30 - Distance (A, D, Down) 30 + 0 = 30 Focus moves from A to B based on rectilinear distance

member.summary: Defines constants that specify which level of layout cycle tracing events should trigger a debugger breakpoint when a layout cycle crash appears imminent.

member.summary: A debugger breakpoint is triggered on more events than the Low setting, including all Measure and Arrange calls.

member.summary: A debugger breakpoint is triggered only at the minimal level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleDebugBreakLevel.None
member.summary: A debugger breakpoint is never triggered.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleTracingLevel
member.summary: Defines constants that specify whether layout cycle tracing information is written to the native debugger and the level of detail that is recorded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleTracingLevel.High
member.summary: More verbose layout cycle information is provided that includes all Measure and Arrange calls with their availableSize and finalSize values. The output is recorded in stowed exceptions in crash dumps. The same information is also output to the native debugger.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleTracingLevel.Low
member.summary: Minimal layout cycle information is recorded in stowed exceptions in crash dumps. The same information is also output to the native debugger.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LayoutCycleTracingLevel.None
member.summary: Minimal layout cycle information is recorded in stowed exceptions in crash dumps. There is no output to the native debugger.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LineStackingStrategy.MaxHeight

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriter
member.summary: Produces a pre-parsed binary representation of a XAML production.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriter.Write(Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVector{Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream},Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVector{Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream},Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.IXamlMetadataProvider)
member.summary:
Produces a binary representation of XAML. Input streams are produced in text representation, and output streams are populated with XAML in binary (XBF) representation.
> [!IMPORTANT] > <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriter?text=XamlBinaryWriter> is not intended for use by typical app code. It is intended for use by tools and processes that are directly involved in producing an app package on a developer's machine.
member.param: The set of input streams. These are expected to access the text representation of the XAML to write into XBF format.
The set of output streams. When the method returns each output stream provides access to the XBF binary representation. You'd typically use this stream to create a file.
A helper object that maps types for XAML productions.
member.returns: A structure that captures any error information that is reported by the conversion into XBF format.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriterErrorInformation
member.summary: Records error information produced by calls to <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriter.Write(Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVector{Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream},Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVector{Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream},Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.IXamlMetadataProvider)?text=XamlBinaryWriter.Write>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriterErrorInformation.InputStreamIndex
member.summary: The index of the stream in the original inputStreams parameter for <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriter.Write(Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVector{Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream},Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVector{Windows.Storage.Streams.IRandomAccessStream},Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.IXamlMetadataProvider)?text=XamlBinaryWriter.Write> where the error occurred.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriterErrorInformation.LineNumber
member.summary: The line number in the input XAML text representation where the error was encountered.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Markup.XamlBinaryWriterErrorInformation.LinePosition
member.summary: The line position in the input XAML text representation where the error was encountered.

member.summary: Interpolation follows the mathematical formula associated with the easing function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.EasingMode.EaseInOut
member.summary: Interpolation uses EaseIn for the first half of the animation and EaseOut for the second half.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.EasingMode.EaseOut
member.summary: Interpolation follows 100% interpolation minus the output of the formula associated with the easing function.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.PowerEase.Power
member.summary: Gets or sets the exponential power of the animation interpolation. For example, a value of 7 creates an animation interpolation curve that follows the formula f (t) = t<sup>7</sup>.
member.returns: The exponential power of the animation interpolation. This value must be greater or equal to 0. The default is 2.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper
member.summary: Provides basic utility methods for processing <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> values. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use members of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> instead.

member.summary: Determines whether two <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> values have equivalent values. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use the equality operator instead. <!-- Link RepeatBehavior.Equals if we add it.-->
member.param: The first <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> to compare.
The second <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> to compare.
member.returns: true if target and value hold equivalent values; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.FromCount(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> based on a repeat count. This corresponds to the intx form when provided as XAML attribute value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use RepeatBehavior(Double) instead.
member.param: The number of times that the target animation should repeat.
member.returns: The created <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior>, which has a RepeatBehaviorType of Count.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.FromDuration(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a new <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> based on a timespan. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use RepeatBehavior(TimeSpan) instead.
member.param: The time span that declares the desired repeat behavior.
member.returns: The created <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior>, which has a RepeatBehaviorType value of Duration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.GetHasCount(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior)
member.summary: Returns whether a specified <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> has a RepeatBehaviorType of Count and a nonzero Count value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use HasCount instead.
member.param: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> to evaluate.
member.returns: true if target has a RepeatBehaviorType of Count and a nonzero Count value. Otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.GetHasDuration(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior)
member.summary: Returns whether a specified <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> has a RepeatBehaviorType of Duration and a nonzero Duration value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use HasDuration instead.
member.param: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> to evaluate.
member.returns: true if target has a RepeatBehaviorType of Duration and a nonzero Duration value. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorHelper.Forever
member.summary: Gets a static <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> that represents the special "Forever" value. C# and Microsoft Visual Basic code should use <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorType?text=RepeatBehaviorType.Forever> instead.
member.returns: A static <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> that represents the special "Forever" value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorType
member.summary: Specifies the repeat mode that a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> raw value represents.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorType.Count
member.summary: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> represents a case where the timeline should repeat for a fixed number of complete runs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorType.Duration
member.summary: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> represents a case where the timeline should repeat for a time duration, which might result in an animation terminating part way through.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehaviorType.Forever
member.summary: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> represents a case where the timeline should repeat indefinitely.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard?text=Storyboard> class.

member.summary: Initiates the set of animations associated with the storyboard.

member.summary: Gets the clock state of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard?text=Storyboard>.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values. Can be: Active, Filling, or Stopped.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.GetCurrentTime
member.summary: Gets the current animation clock time of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard?text=Storyboard>.
member.returns: The current animation time of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard?text=Storyboard> per the running animation clock, or null if the animation clock is Stopped.

member.summary: Gets the value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.TargetName?text=Storyboard.TargetName> XAML attached property from a target element.
member.param: The target element from which to get the value.
member.returns: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.TargetName?text=Storyboard.TargetName> value of the target element.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.GetTargetProperty(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline)
member.summary: Gets the value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.TargetProperty?text=Storyboard.TargetProperty> XAML attached property from a target element.

member.returns: The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.TargetProperty?text=Storyboard.TargetProperty> value of the target element.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the animation clock associated with the storyboard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.Resume
member.summary: Resumes the animation clock, or run-time state, associated with the storyboard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.Seek(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Moves the storyboard to the specified animation position. The storyboard performs the requested seek when the next clock tick occurs.
member.param: A positive or negative time value that describes the amount by which the timeline should move forward or backward from the beginning of the animation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SeekAlignedToLastTick(Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Moves the storyboard to the specified animation position immediately (synchronously).
member.param: A positive or negative time value that describes the amount by which the timeline should move forward or backward from the beginning of the animation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SetTarget(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Causes the specified <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline?text=Timeline> to target the specified object.
member.param: The timeline that targets the specified dependency object.
The actual instance of the object to target.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SetTargetName(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.TargetName?text=Storyboard.TargetName> XAML attached property for a target element.
member.param: The target element to set the value for.

The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.TargetName?text=Storyboard.TargetName> value of the target element to set. This should correspond to an existing <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.Name?text=Name> or x:Name value on the UI element that the animation targets.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SetTargetProperty(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.TargetProperty?text=Storyboard.TargetProperty> XAML attached property for a target element.
member.param: The target element for which to set the value.

The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.TargetProperty?text=Storyboard.TargetProperty> value of the target element to set. This specifies a qualification path that targets the dependency property where the animation applies. See Remarks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.SkipToFill
member.summary: Advances the current time of the storyboard's clock to the end of its active period.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.Stop
member.summary: Stops the storyboard.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline
member.summary: Defines a duration and other behavior properties for a Windows Runtime animation. Timeline is the base class for <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard?text=Storyboard> and all the Windows Runtime animation types, including those from the animation library and those used for custom animations in visual states or page-level XAML.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.Completed
member.summary: Occurs when the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard?text=Storyboard> object has completed playing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.#ctor
member.summary: Provides base class initialization behavior for <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline?text=Timeline>-derived classes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.AllowDependentAnimations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether dependent animations should be permitted to run, throughout the app.
member.returns: true if animations can run in the app for dependent animation cases. Otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.AutoReverse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the timeline plays in reverse after it completes a forward iteration.
member.returns: true if the timeline plays in reverse at the end of each iteration; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.AutoReverseProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.AutoReverse?text=AutoReverse> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.AutoReverse?text=AutoReverse> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which this <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline?text=Timeline> should begin.
member.returns: The start time of the time line. The default value is zero. <!--Projection dochack:--> If you are programming using C# or Visual Basic, the parameter type of this parameter is projected as **System.TimeSpan?**(a nullable System.TimeSpan.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTimeProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime?text=BeginTime> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime?text=BeginTime> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time for which this timeline plays, not counting repetitions.
member.returns: The timeline's simple duration: the amount of time this timeline takes to complete a single forward iteration. The default value is a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Duration?text=Duration> that evaluates as <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DurationHelper.Automatic?text=Automatic>.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.DurationProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration?text=Duration> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration?text=Duration> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.FillBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how the animation behaves after it reaches the end of its active period.
member.returns: A value that specifies how the timeline behaves after it reaches the end of its active period but its parent is inside its active or fill period. The default value is HoldEnd.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.FillBehaviorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.FillBehavior?text=FillBehavior> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.FillBehavior?text=FillBehavior> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets the repeating behavior of this timeline.
member.returns: An iteration Count that specifies the number of times the timeline should play, a TimeSpan value that specifies the total length of this timeline's active period, or the special value Forever, which specifies that the timeline should repeat indefinitely. The default value is a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> with a Count value of 1, which indicates that the timeline plays once. <!--Don't link Timespan above it is a projected type and an authored link introduces a bias.-->

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehaviorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.RepeatBehavior?text=RepeatBehavior> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the rate, relative to its parent, at which time progresses for this <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline?text=Timeline>.
member.returns: A finite value greater than 0 that specifies the rate at which time progresses for this timeline, relative to the speed of the timeline's parent. If this timeline is a root timeline, specifies the default timeline speed. The value is expressed as a factor where 1 represents normal speed, 2 is double speed, 0.5 is half speed, and so on. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatioProperty
member.summary: Identifies for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio?text=SpeedRatio> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio?text=SpeedRatio> dependency property.

member.summary: Represents a collection of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Timeline?text=Timeline> objects (specific type animations). A TimelineCollection is the value of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.Storyboard.Children?text=Storyboard.Children> property.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Animation.TimelineCollection?text=TimelineCollection> class.

member.summary: Adds a new item to the collection.

member.summary: Removes all items from the collection.

member.summary: Returns the iterator for iteration over the items in the collection.
member.returns: The iterator object. The iterator's current position is at the 0-index position, or at the collection end if the collection is empty.

member.summary: The coordinate system is not relative to a bounding box. Values are interpreted directly in local space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.BrushMappingMode.RelativeToBoundingBox
member.summary: The coordinate system is relative to a bounding box: 0 indicates 0 percent of the bounding box, and 1 indicates 100 percent of the bounding box. For example, (0.5, 0.5) describes a point in the middle of the bounding box, and (1, 1) describes a point at the lower right of the bounding box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.ElementCompositeMode.MinBlend

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.ElementCompositeMode.SourceOver
member.summary: Uses standard XAML source-over-destination mode. This corresponds to D2D1_PRIMITIVE_BLEND_SOURCE_OVER.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FastPlayFallbackBehaviour
member.summary: Defines constants that specify how <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.MediaTransportControls?text=MediaTransportControls> fast-forward/backward buttons behave.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FastPlayFallbackBehaviour.Disable
member.summary: If the media doesn't support fast-forward/fast-rewind, the buttons are disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FastPlayFallbackBehaviour.Hide
member.summary: If the media doesn't support fast-forward/fast-rewind, the buttons are hidden.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FastPlayFallbackBehaviour.Skip
member.summary: If the media doesn't support fast-forward/fast-rewind, the media skips 30 seconds.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule
member.summary: Specifies how the intersecting areas of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PathFigure?text=PathFigure> objects contained in a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Geometry?text=Geometry> are combined to form the area of the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Geometry?text=Geometry>.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments within the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.FillRule.Nonzero
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region of the path by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray. Starting with a count of zero, add one each time a segment crosses the ray from left to right and subtract one each time a path segment crosses the ray from right to left. After counting the crossings, if the result is zero then the point is outside the path. Otherwise, it is inside.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap
member.summary: Describes the shape at the end of a line or segment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Flat
member.summary: A cap that does not extend past the last point of the line. Comparable to no line cap.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Round
member.summary: A semicircle that has a diameter equal to the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Square
member.summary: A rectangle that has a height equal to the line thickness and a length equal to half the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineCap.Triangle
member.summary: An isosceles right triangle whose base length is equal to the thickness of the line.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineJoin
member.summary: Describes the shape that joins two lines or segments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: Line joins use beveled vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: Line joins use regular angular vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PenLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Line joins use rounded vertices.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection
member.summary: Represents a perspective transform (a 3-D-like effect) on an object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.#ctor

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationX
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The x-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. Typical values are between 0 and 1 with a value of 0 corresponding to one edge of the object and 1 to the opposite edge. Values outside this range are allowed and move the center of rotation accordingly. The default is 0.5 (the center of object).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationXProperty
member.summary: Identifies the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationX?text=CenterOfRotationX> dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationX?text=CenterOfRotationX> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationY
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The y-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. Typical values are between 0 and 1 with a value of 0 corresponding to one edge of the object and 1 to the opposite edge. Values outside this range are allowed and move the center of rotation accordingly. The default is 0.5 (the center of object).

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationYProperty

member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationY?text=CenterOfRotationY> dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.PlaneProjection.CenterOfRotationZ
member.summary: Gets or sets the z-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate.
member.returns: The z-coordinate of the center of rotation of the object that you rotate. The default is 0. Values greater than 0 correspond to coordinates in front of the plane of the object, and negative values correspond to coordinates behind the plane of the object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.ThemeShadow
member.summary:
A ThemeShadow is a preconfigured shadow effect that can be applied to any XAML element to draw shadows appropriately based on x, y, z coordinates. ThemeShadow also automatically adjusts for other environmental specifications:
- Adapts to changes in lighting, user theme, app environment, and shell. - Shadows elements automatically based on their elevation. - Keeps elements in sync as they move and change elevation. - Keeps shadows consistent throughout and across applications.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods that can be used to traverse object relationships (along child-object or parent-object axes) in the visual tree of your app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.DisconnectChildrenRecursive(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Explicitly removes all references from a target <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement>, with the goal of cleaning up reference cycles.
member.param: The target object to disconnect children and remove references from.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Point,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified x-y coordinate point of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share that point.
member.param: The point to use as the determination point. This point is using the coordinate space of the app window, not of any specific element (and not of subtree if specified).

An object to search for. If the subtree object exists in the overall set of elements that exist at the specified intersectingPoint coordinates, then the return value contains only the subtree object and any objects that have a higher z-order than subtree, listed by inverse of z-order. If the subtree object doesn't exist at intersectingPoint coordinates, the return value will be empty.
true to include all elements that intersect, including those elements considered to be invisible to hit testing. false to find only visible, hit-testable elements. The default is false.
member.returns: An enumerable set of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> objects that are determined to be located in the visual tree composition at the specified point, listed by inverse of z-order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Point,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified x-y coordinate point of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share that point.
member.param: The point to use as the determination point. This point is using the coordinate space of the app window, not of any specific element (and not of subtree if specified).

An object to search for. If the subtree object exists in the overall set of elements that exist at the specified intersectingPoint coordinates, then the return value contains only the subtree object and any objects that have a higher z-order than subtree, listed by inverse of z-order. If the subtree object doesn't exist at intersectingPoint coordinates, the return value will be empty.
member.returns: An enumerable set of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> objects in the visual tree composition at the specified point, listed by inverse of z-order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Rect,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified Rect frame of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share a rectangular area, and might include elements that overdraw.
member.param: The Rect.

An object to search for. If the subtree object exists in the overall set of elements that exist within the specified intersectingRect, then the return value contains only the subtree object and elements that are drawing on top of its space. If the subtree object doesn't exist within the intersectingRect frame, the return value will be empty.
true to include all elements that intersect, including those elements considered to be invisible to hit testing. false to find only visible, hit-testable elements. The default is false.
member.returns: An enumerable set of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> objects that are determined to be located in the visual tree composition in the specified Rect frame.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.FindElementsInHostCoordinates(Windows.Foundation.Rect,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Retrieves a set of objects that are located within a specified Rect frame of an app UI. The set of objects represents the components of a visual tree that share a rectangular area, and might include elements that overdraw.
member.param: The Rect.

An object to search for. If the subtree object exists in the overall set of elements that exist within the specified intersectingRect, then the return value contains only the subtree object and elements that are drawing on top of its space. If the subtree object doesn't exist within the intersectingRect frame, the return value will be empty.
member.returns: An enumerable set of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> objects that are in the visual tree composition in the specified Rect frame.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.GetChild(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject,System.Int32)
member.summary: Using the provided index, obtains a specific child object of the provided object by examining the visual tree.
member.param: The object that holds the child collection.
The index of the requested child object in the reference child collection.
member.returns: The child object as referenced by childIndex.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.VisualTreeHelper.GetChildrenCount(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Returns the number of children that exist in an object's child collection in the visual tree.
member.param: The source visual.
member.returns: The number of visual children for the provided source visual.

member.summary: Retrieves a collection of all open popup controls from the target <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Window?text=Window>.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase
member.summary: Provides a base class used to create XAML brushes that paint an area with a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionBrush?text=CompositionBrush>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.#ctor
member.summary: Provides base class initialization behavior for XamlCompositionBrushBase derived classes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.OnConnected
member.summary:
Invoked when a brush is first used on screen to paint an element.
When implemented in a derived class, you can create a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionBrush?text=CompositionBrush> instance and provide it to the framework by setting the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionBrush?text=CompositionBrush> property.
<xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.OnDisconnected?text=OnDisconnected> will be called when the brush is no longer being used to paint any elements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.OnDisconnected
member.summary:
Invoked when the brush is no longer being used to paint any elements.
When implemented in a derived class, you can safely dispose of the compostion brush and other composition resources.
<xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.OnConnected?text=OnConnected> will be called again if the brush is later used to paint any elements after being disconnected.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.CompositionBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionBrush?text=CompositionBrush> used by this XAML brush.
member.returns: The instance of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionBrush?text=CompositionBrush> used by this XAML brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.FallbackColor
member.summary: The color to use for rendering in case the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Composition.CompositionBrush?text=CompositionBrush> can't be rendered.
member.returns: The color to use for rendering in place of the composition brush.

member.name: P:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlCompositionBrushBase.FallbackColorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the FallbackColor dependency property.
member.returns: The identifier for the FallbackColor dependency property.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the XamlLight class.

member.summary: Sets a Brush as a target of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight?text=XamlLight>.
member.param: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight?text=XamlLight> that should target the Brush.
The Brush that the light should target.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.AddTargetElement(System.String,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Sets a UIElement as a target of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight?text=XamlLight>.
member.param: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight?text=XamlLight> that should target the UIElement.
The UIElement that the light should target.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.GetId
member.summary:
Returns the identifier for the custom <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight?text=XamlLight> type.
In most cases you should use a unique identifier to prevent conflicts. For example, you can use the FullName of your custom XamlLight type.
The identifier is used to add and remove Brushes and UIElements as targets for a specific light type.
member.returns: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight?text=XamlLight>.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.OnConnected(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary:
This method is automatically called when the XamlLight is first in use on the screen, or after being previously disconnected then used again.
This provides an opportunity to create resources such as the CompositionLight only when required.
<xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.OnDisconnected(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)?text=OnDisconnected> will be called when the XamlLight is no longer being used to light any UIElements or Brushes.
member.param: The UIElement that the light is attached to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.OnDisconnected(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary:
This method is automatically called when the XamlLight is no longer in use anywhere on the screen.
This provides an opportunity to safely dispose of resources such as the CompositionLight when they aren't currently required.
<xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.OnConnected(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)?text=OnConnected> will be called again if the XamlLight is later used to light any UIElements or Brushes after being disconnected.
member.param: The UIElement that the light is attached to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.RemoveTargetBrush(System.String,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.Brush)
member.summary: Stops a Brush from being a target of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight?text=XamlLight>.
member.param: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight?text=XamlLight> that should no longer target the Brush.
The Brush that the light should no longer target.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight.RemoveTargetElement(System.String,Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement)
member.summary: Stops a UIElement from being a target of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight?text=XamlLight>.
member.param: The identifier for the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media.XamlLight?text=XamlLight> that should no longer target the UIElement.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationCacheMode
member.summary: Specifies caching characteristics for a page involved in a navigation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationCacheMode.Disabled
member.summary: The page is never cached and a new instance of the page is created on each visit.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationCacheMode.Enabled
member.summary: The page is cached, but the cached instance is discarded when the size of the cache for the frame is exceeded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Navigation.NavigationCacheMode.Required
member.summary: The page is cached and the cached instance is reused for every visit regardless of the cache size for the frame.

member.summary: The end of the text is aligned to the edge of the container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextAlignment.Justify
member.summary: Text is justified within the container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextAlignment.Left
member.summary: Text is aligned to the left edge of the container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextAlignment.Right
member.summary: Text is aligned to the right edge of the container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextAlignment.Start
member.summary: The beginning of the text is aligned to the edge of the container.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds
member.summary: Influences how a line box height is calculated

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.Full
member.summary: Uses normal line box height calculation, this is the default.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.Tight
member.summary: Top of line box height is the cap height from the font, bottom of line box height is the text baseline.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.TrimToBaseline
member.summary: Bottom of line box height is the text baseline.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextLineBounds.TrimToCapHeight
member.summary: Top of line box height is the cap height from the font.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder
member.summary: Provides a value for TextReadingOrder properties.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder.Default
member.summary: Do not detect flow direction from content. Use <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FlowDirection?text=FlowDirection> value (if any) for reading order decisions. (Do not use. See Remarks.)

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder.DetectFromContent
member.summary: Detect flow direction from text content. For bidirectional text, text containers will infer the reading order for text based on the content. See Remarks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextReadingOrder.UseFlowDirection
member.summary: Do not detect flow direction from content. Use <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FlowDirection?text=FlowDirection> value (if any) for reading order decisions. (See Remarks.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming
member.summary: Describes how text is trimmed when it overflows the edge of its containing box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.CharacterEllipsis
member.summary: Text is trimmed at a character boundary. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.Clip
member.summary: Text is trimmed at a pixel level, visually clipping the excess glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.None
member.summary:
Default.
Text is truncated at a word boundary.
No trim indicator is drawn and the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.RichTextBlock?text=RichTextBlock>/<xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.TextBlock?text=TextBlock> IsTextTrimmedChanged event does not fire.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextTrimming.WordEllipsis
member.summary: Text is trimmed at a word boundary. An ellipsis (...) is drawn in place of remaining text.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping
member.summary: Specifies whether text wraps when it reaches the edge of its container.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping.NoWrap
member.summary: No line wrapping is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping.Wrap
member.summary: Line breaking occurs if a line of text overflows beyond the available width of its container. Line breaking occurs even if the text logic can't determine any line break opportunity. For example, if a very long word is constrained in a fixed-width container that can't scroll, it will wrap at a point that might be in the middle of a word.

member.name: F:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.TextWrapping.WrapWholeWords
member.summary: Line-breaking occurs if the line overflows beyond the available block width. A line may overflow beyond the block width if the text logic can't determine a line break opportunity. For example, if a very long word is constrained in a fixed-width container that can't scroll, it will overflow the long word and continue the text after the long word on the next line. Not supported by all controls; see Remarks.

member.name: T:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement
member.summary: UIElement is a base class for most of the Windows Runtime UI objects that have visual appearance and can process basic input as part of your app's user interface.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AccessKeyDisplayDismissed
member.summary: Occurs when access keys should no longer be displayed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AccessKeyDisplayRequested
member.summary: Occurs when the user requests that access keys be displayed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AccessKeyInvoked
member.summary: Occurs when a user completes an access key sequence.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.BringIntoViewRequested
member.summary: Occurs when <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.StartBringIntoView?text=StartBringIntoView> is called on this element or one of its descendants.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.CharacterReceived
member.summary: Occurs when a single, composed character is received by the input queue.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ContextCanceled
member.summary: Occurs when a context input gesture continues into a manipulation gesture, to notify the element that the context flyout should not be opened.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ContextRequested
member.summary: Occurs when the user has completed a context input gesture, such as a right-click.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DoubleTapped
member.summary: Occurs when an otherwise unhandled DoubleTap interaction occurs over the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DragEnter
member.summary: Occurs when the input system reports an underlying drag event with this element as the target.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DragLeave
member.summary: Occurs when the input system reports an underlying drag event with this element as the origin.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DragOver
member.summary: Occurs when the input system reports an underlying drag event with this element as the potential drop target.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DragStarting
member.summary: Occurs when a drag operation is initiated.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Drop
member.summary: Occurs when the input system reports an underlying drop event with this element as the drop target.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DropCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when a drag-and-drop operation with this element as the source is ended.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.GettingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> receives focus. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.GotFocus
member.summary: Occurs when a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> receives focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus can move again before bubbling is complete.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Holding
member.summary: Occurs when an otherwise unhandled Hold interaction occurs over the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.KeyDown
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is pressed while the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> has focus.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.KeyUp
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is released while the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> has focus.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.LosingFocus
member.summary: Occurs before a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> loses focus. This event is raised synchronously to ensure focus isn't moved while the event is bubbling.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.LostFocus
member.summary: Occurs when a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> loses focus. This event is raised asynchronously, so focus can move again before bubbling is complete.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when a manipulation on the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> is complete.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationDelta
member.summary: Occurs when the input device changes position during a manipulation.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationInertiaStarting
member.summary: Occurs when the input device loses contact with the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> object during a manipulation and inertia begins.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationStarted
member.summary: Occurs when an input device begins a manipulation on the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement>.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ManipulationStarting
member.summary: Occurs when the manipulation processor is first created.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.NoFocusCandidateFound
member.summary: Occurs when a user attempts to move focus (via tab or directional arrows), but focus doesn't move because no focus candidate is found in the direction of movement.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerCanceled
member.summary: Occurs when a pointer that made contact abnormally loses contact.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerCaptureLost
member.summary: Occurs when pointer capture previously held by this element moves to another element or elsewhere.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerEntered
member.summary: Occurs when a pointer enters the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerExited
member.summary: Occurs when a pointer leaves the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerMoved
member.summary: Occurs when a pointer moves while the pointer remains within the hit test area of this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerPressed
member.summary: Occurs when the pointer device initiates a Press action within this element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerReleased
member.summary: Occurs when the pointer device that previously initiated a Press action is released, while within this element. Note that the end of a Press action is not guaranteed to fire a PointerReleased event; other events may fire instead. For more info, see Remarks.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PointerWheelChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the delta value of a pointer wheel changes.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PreviewKeyDown
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is pressed while the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> has focus.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.PreviewKeyUp
member.summary: Occurs when a keyboard key is released while the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> has focus.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.ProcessKeyboardAccelerators
member.summary: Occurs when a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.KeyboardAccelerator?text=keyboard shortcut (or accelerator)> is pressed.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.RightTapped
member.summary: Occurs when a right-tap input stimulus happens while the pointer is over the element.

member.name: E:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Tapped
member.summary: Occurs when an otherwise unhandled Tap interaction occurs over the hit test area of this element.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.AddHandler(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.RoutedEvent,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a routed event handler for a specified routed event, adding the handler to the handler collection on the current element. Specify handledEventsToo as true to have the provided handler be invoked even if the event is handled elsewhere.
member.param: An identifier for the routed event to be handled.
A reference to the handler implementation.

true to register the handler such that it is invoked even when the routed event is marked handled in its event data.
false to register the handler with the default condition that it will not be invoked if the routed event is already marked handled. The default is false.
Do not routinely ask to rehandle a routed event, because it interferes with the intended design of the Windows Runtime event system for control compositing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Arrange(Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Positions child objects and determines a size for a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement>. Parent objects that implement custom layout for their child elements should call this method from their layout override implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The final size that the parent computes for the child in layout, provided as a Rect value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.CancelDirectManipulations
member.summary: Cancels ongoing direct manipulation processing (system-defined panning/zooming) on any <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer> parent that contains the current <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement>.
member.returns: true if a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ScrollViewer?text=ScrollViewer> parent exists and setting the value resulted in canceling the panning/zooming action. false if calling the method results in no action.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.CapturePointer(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Input.Pointer)
member.summary: Sets pointer capture to a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement>. Once captured, only the element that has capture will fire pointer-related events.
member.param: The pointer object reference.
member.returns: true if the object has pointer capture; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.FindSubElementsForTouchTargeting(Windows.Foundation.Point,Windows.Foundation.Rect)
member.summary: Enables a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement> subclass to expose child elements that assist with resolving touch targeting.
member.param: The point being touched.
The bounds used for touch tolerance.
member.returns: A set of point sets. These represent the vertices of sub elements that are intersected by the given touch point (plus tolerance).

member.name: M:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.Focus(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FocusState)
member.summary: Attempts to set focus to this element.
member.param: How this element obtains focus.
member.returns: True if keyboard focus and logical focus were set to this element. False if only logical focus was set to this element, or if the call to this method did not force the focus to change.

member.summary: Updates the <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement.DesiredSize?text=DesiredSize> of a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement?text=UIElement>. Typically, objects that implement custom layout for their layout children call this method from their own <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement.MeasureOverride(Windows.Foundation.Size)?text=MeasureOverride> implementations to form a recursive layout update.
member.param: The available space that a parent can allocate to a child object. A child object can request a larger space than what is available; the provided size might be accommodated if scrolling or other resize behavior is possible in that particular container.

member.returns: A collection of <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Setter?text=Setter> objects. The default is an empty collection.

true to use a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.VisualTransition?text=VisualTransition> to transition between states. false to skip using transitions and go directly to the requested state. The default is false.

The root element of the control's <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls.ControlTemplate?text=ControlTemplate>.
The name of the state to transition to.
The <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.VisualStateGroup?text=VisualStateGroup> that the state belongs to.
The representation of the state to transition to.
true to use a <xref:Microsoft.UI.Xaml.VisualTransition?text=VisualTransition> to transition between states; otherwise, false.
member.returns: true if the control successfully transitions to the new state; otherwise, false.
